subsection.proviso: Provided that it shall be a defence in proceedings for an offence under this section for the defendant to prove that he had reasonable cause to believe that the vehicle would not be used on a road in Hong Kong or would not be so used until it had been put into a condition in which it might be used without contravening any such provisions.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall affect the validity of any contract or of any right arising under a contract.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Restriction on hire and riding of cycles

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), no person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hire a bicycle or tricycle to a child under 11 years of age; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permit a child under 11 years of age to ride a bicycle or tricycle on a road unaccompanied by an adult.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hire a multi-cycle to a child under 11 years of age; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permit any such child to ride, otherwise than as a passenger, or to steer a multi-cycle, unless the child is accompanied by an adult. (Added 89 of 1994 s. 21)

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes subsection (1) or (1A) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2. (Amended 89 of 1994 s. 21; E.R. 2 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: This section shall not apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of subsection (1)(a), to any person who hires a bicycle or tricycle to a child under 11 years of age if the hiring takes place or occurs—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on a road or portion of a road set aside for bicycles or tricycles and on which children under 11 years of age may, in accordance with a permission indicated by a prescribed traffic sign erected or placed there, ride such bicycles or tricycles unaccompanied by any adult; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on any other land (whether a road or not) which immediately abuts or adjoins a road or portion of a road referred to in subparagraph (i) and on which the driving of all motor vehicles is prohibited; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b), to any person who permits a child under 11 years of age to ride a bicycle or tricycle on a road or portion of a road set aside for bicycles or tricycles and on which children under 11 years of age may, in accordance with a permission indicated by a prescribed traffic sign erected or placed there, ride such bicycles or tricycles unaccompanied by any adult.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Restriction on motor racing and speed trials

subsection.leadIn: A person who promotes or takes part in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a race or trial of speed on any road between vehicles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any race or trial on any road between persons; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other form of competition on any road involving vehicles or pedestrians,

subsection.continued: to which the Commissioner of Police has not given his consent in writing, or in contravention of any conditions imposed on the granting of such consent, commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 12 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

subsection.content: If a magistrate convicts a person of an offence under subsection (1), the magistrate shall order that the person be disqualified in accordance with subsection (2A) unless the magistrate for special reasons orders that the person be disqualified for a shorter period or that the person not be disqualified. (Replaced 23 of 2008 s. 15)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: The person is to be disqualified—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), for a period of 12 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the magistrate has ordered the person to attend and complete a driving improvement course under section 72A(1A), for a period of 12 months, or until the person has attended and completed the course at his own cost, whichever is the later. (Added 23 of 2008 s. 15)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2), a person to whom subsection (2A)(b) applies is disqualified for a shorter period if he is disqualified for a period of less than 12 months, or until the person has attended and completed the driving improvement course at his own cost, whichever is the later. (Added 23 of 2008 s. 15)

The Commissioner of Police may if he thinks fit consent to the promotion or holding of any such event as is described in subsection (1) subject to such conditions as he in his absolute discretion may impose.
Any person aggrieved by any decision of the Commissioner of Police under subsection (3) may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board against such decision. (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 3)

section.name: s56
section.heading: Duty to stop in case of accidents

subsection.leadIn: Where, owing to the presence of a vehicle on a road, an accident occurs whereby—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: personal injury is caused to a person other than the driver of that vehicle; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: damage is caused to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a vehicle other than that vehicle or a trailer drawn thereby;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a specified animal (other than one in or on that vehicle or a trailer drawn by that vehicle); or (Replaced 8 of 2021 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any other thing not being in or on that vehicle or a trailer drawn thereby,

subsection.continued: the driver of that vehicle shall stop.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of any such accident, the driver of the vehicle shall, if required, give to any police officer or to any person having reasonable grounds for so requiring the following particulars—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: his name and address;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name and address of the owner of the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the registration or identification mark or number of the vehicle. [cf. 1972 c. 20 s. 25(2) U.K.]

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If, in the case of an accident referred to in subsection (1)(b), the driver of the vehicle for any reason does not give the particulars mentioned in subsection (2), he shall report the accident in person at the nearest police station or to any police officer as soon as reasonably practicable, and in any case not later than 24 hours after the accident. (Added 66 of 1984 s. 7)

If the accident involves injury to any person including the driver, the driver shall report the accident in person at the nearest police station or to any police officer as soon as reasonably practicable, and in any case not later than 24 hours after the accident, unless the driver is incapable of doing so by reason of injuries sustained by him in the accident. [cf. 1972 c. 20 s. 25(3) U.K.]
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 12 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

A person who contravenes subsection (2), (2A) or (3) or who knowingly makes a false statement in supplying particulars under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified animal (指明動物) means any horse, cattle, ass, mule, sheep, pig, goat, cat or dog. (Added 8 of 2021 s. 3)

section.name: s57
section.heading: Preservation of evidence of serious accidents

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), if owing to the presence of a vehicle on a road an accident occurs in consequence of which any person is killed or seriously injured or serious damage is caused to any vehicle or thing, any person who without the authority of a police officer moves or otherwise interferes with any vehicle involved in the accident or any part of any such vehicle or does any other act which destroys, alters or conceals any evidence of the accident commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

In any proceedings against a person in respect of the moving of or interference with a vehicle in contravention of subsection (1), it shall be a defence for the person charged to prove that the vehicle was moved or interfered with for the purpose of saving life, extinguishing fire or meeting any other emergency.
The Commissioner of Police may appoint such persons as he thinks fit to be traffic wardens or senior traffic wardens.

subsection.leadIn: Traffic wardens shall discharge, in aid of the Hong Kong Police Force, the following functions— (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the enforcement of the Fixed Penalty (Traffic Contraventions) Ordinance (Cap. 237);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the control and regulation of vehicular traffic and pedestrians, whether on a road or not, and any functions incidental to, or connected with, the control and regulation of such traffic or pedestrians, which are normally undertaken by the Police Force; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other functions which may be conferred on them by or under this or any other Ordinance.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: For the purposes of discharging his functions under subsection (2), a traffic warden may require any person whom he reasonably suspects of having committed an offence under this Ordinance to give his name and address. (Added 39 of 1995 s. 8)
Subject to subsection (4), for the purposes of discharging his functions under subsection (2), a traffic warden shall have all the powers and duties of a police officer.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsection (3), a traffic warden shall not have power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to arrest or detain a person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to search a person.

subsection.content: Traffic wardens shall be subject to the orders and directions of the Commissioner of Police.
A traffic warden shall obey all lawful orders given to him by a police officer of or above the rank of sergeant.
A traffic warden shall be deemed to be always on duty when required to act as such and shall discharge his functions as such in any and every place in Hong Kong where he may be doing duty.
An identity card shall be issued to every traffic warden and shall be evidence of his appointment.
A traffic warden whilst on duty shall wear the uniform of a traffic warden.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who is not a traffic warden and who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wears, without the permission of the Commissioner of Police, the uniform of a traffic warden or any dress having the appearance, or bearing any of the distinctive marks, of that uniform;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has in his possession, without the permission of the Commissioner of Police, an identity card issued to a traffic warden under subsection (2),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

subsection.content: Any person who ceases to be a traffic warden, whether in consequence of resignation or dismissal or otherwise, shall thereupon deliver up his uniform and his identity card and any other Government property which may be in his possession.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Power of police to stop vehicles
section.content: A person driving a motor vehicle or rickshaw on a road and a person riding a bicycle or tricycle on a road shall stop the same on being so required by a police officer in uniform, or traffic warden in uniform, and any person who fails to do so commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Penalty for neglect of traffic directions
section.content: Where a police officer in uniform or a traffic warden in uniform is for the time being engaged in the regulation of traffic on a road, any person driving any vehicle and any pedestrian who neglects or refuses to obey any direction of the police officer or traffic warden commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s61A
section.heading: Drivers of vehicles of the North-west Railway to obey police directions in emergency

subsection.content: Where there is an emergency on or in the vicinity of the carriageway of the North-west Railway, a police officer in uniform may give directions to the driver of any vehicle of the North-west Railway for the purpose of saving or protecting any life or property in imminent danger or clearing any obstruction to the North-west Railway and any such driver shall obey the directions.

Any driver of a vehicle of the North-west Railway who fails to obey a direction of a police officer given under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 1. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

section.name: s62
section.heading: Penalty for obstruction
section.content: Without prejudice to any other provisions of this Ordinance, any person who obstructs any police officer or traffic warden or the Commissioner in the exercise of any power conferred under this Ordinance commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 1 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s62A
section.heading: Interpretation of sections 63A, 63B, 63C, 63D, 63E, 63F and 63G
section.leadIn: In sections 63A, 63B, 63C, 63D, 63E, 63F and 63G—
section.def: demand notice (要求通知書)—see section 63A(1);
driver concerned (涉事司機) has the meaning given by section 63(4);
electronic message (電子訊息) means—(a)an electronic mail; or(b)an SMS message;
electronic record (電子紀錄) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the ETO;
ETO (《電子交易條例》) means the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553);
information system (資訊系統) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the ETO;
personal particulars (個人詳情) has the meaning given by section 63(4).

section.name: s63
section.heading: Police officer may demand certain information in respect of alleged offences or accidents

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the driver of a vehicle is suspected of having committed an offence under this Ordinance (alleged offence); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an accident occurs owing to the presence of a vehicle on a road.

subsection.leadIn: A police officer may demand a person to provide—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for an alleged offence—

subparagraph.content: if the person is the driver concerned—the personal particulars of the person; or

subparagraph.leadIn: if the person is not the driver concerned—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the personal particulars of the driver concerned; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the relationship (if any) of the person to the driver concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for an accident—

subparagraph.content: if the person is the driver concerned—the personal particulars of the person; or

subparagraph.leadIn: if the person is not the driver concerned—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the personal particulars of the driver concerned; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the relationship (if any) of the person to the driver concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A demand under subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made within 6 months after the date of the alleged offence or accident; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may be made—

subparagraph.content: orally; or
by notice in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: personal particulars (個人詳情), in relation to a person, means the name, address, e-contact means and driving licence number of the person.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under section 63(3)(b)(ii) (demand notice) must be served by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: delivering the notice personally to the person on whom the demand under section 63(2) is made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: post to—

subparagraph.content: if the demand is made on the registered owner of the vehicle—the registered address of the owner; or
if the demand is made on the driver concerned or any other person—the driver’s or the person’s last known postal address.

subsection.content: Subsection (3) applies if the person on whom the demand under section 63(2) is made has a registered e-contact means.

subsection.leadIn: A demand notice may otherwise be served by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: making the notice available for inspection by the person on whom the demand under section 63(2) is made by means of an information system designated by the Commissioner of Police; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: as soon as reasonably practicable after making the notice available for inspection, sending an electronic message in the specified form containing the following information through the registered e-contact means of the person—

subparagraph.content: the way in which the corresponding demand notice may be inspected;
the period for the provision of the information;
the consequence for failing to provide the information;
the method of enquiry;
the date of the message.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3)(b), the reference to sending an electronic message through a registered e-contact means is to be construed as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the registered e-contact means is an electronic mail address—sending the message to the electronic mail address by an electronic mail; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the registered e-contact means is a telephone number—sending the message to the telephone number by an SMS message.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: registered e-contact means (經登記電子聯絡方式), in relation to a person, means the e-contact means of the person provided to the Commissioner in accordance with regulations made under this Ordinance.

section.name: s63B
section.heading: Obligation to provide information in respect of alleged offences or accidents

subsection.content: This section applies if a demand has been made by a police officer under section 63(2).

subsection.leadIn: The person on whom the demand is made orally must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person is the driver concerned—immediately provide to the police officer the person’s personal particulars; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is not the driver concerned—provide either orally or in writing the information specified in section 63(2)(a)(ii) or (b)(ii) (as appropriate) to the police officer who made the demand within 21 days after the date of the demand.

subsection.content: The person on whom a demand notice is served under section 63A(1) or (3) must, in compliance with subsection (4), provide to the police officer specified in the notice the information specified in section 63(2)(a) or (b) (as appropriate) within 21 days after the date of the demand notice or the date of the corresponding electronic message (if any), whichever is the later.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3), the information must be provided—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the form of a written statement that is—

subparagraph.content: in accordance with the form specified in the demand notice; and
signed by the person on whom the notice is served; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the form of an electronic record that is—

subparagraph.content: signed in accordance with section 63C by the person on whom the demand notice is served; and
sent in accordance with that section.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

A person who knowingly makes a false statement in providing information under subsection (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In proceedings for an offence under subsection (5), it is a defence for the person charged with the offence to show that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person contravenes subsection (2) or (3)—that person—

subparagraph.content: did not know; and
could not with reasonable diligence have ascertained,

paragraph.continued: the personal particulars of the driver concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person contravenes subsection (3)—the demand notice has not come to the personal notice of that person without any neglect by that person.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (9) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is convicted of an offence under subsection (5) or (6); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the offence of which the person is convicted is an offence in connection with providing to a police officer the personal particulars of the driver of a vehicle at the time of an alleged offence.

subsection.leadIn: The court before whom the person under subsection (8) is convicted must have regard to the facts of the alleged offence in considering—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of any fine, or period of imprisonment, to impose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period, if any, for which to order that person to be disqualified,

subsection.continued: for the offence under subsection (5) or (6).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: alleged offence (指控罪行)—see section 63(1)(a).

section.name: s63C
section.heading: Information provided in form of electronic record

subsection.leadIn: If the person on whom a demand notice is served under section 63A(1)(b) or (3) (specified person) wishes to provide any information specified in section 63(2)(a) or (b) (as appropriate) in the form of an electronic record (electronic record), the person must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sign the electronic record; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send the information to the information system designated by the Commissioner of Police (information system).

subsection.leadIn: The electronic record is taken to have been received by the police officer specified in the demand notice if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the electronic record is sent in accordance with subsection (1)(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the electronic record is accepted by the information system; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the information system generates a record confirming the acceptance.

subsection.leadIn: The requirement for a signature on the electronic record under subsection (1)(a) is met by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the specified person is a natural person—

subparagraph.content: a digital signature of the specified person; or
a password of that person assigned or approved under subsection (4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the specified person is a corporation—

subparagraph.content: a digital signature of a person who is authorized by the specified person to send the electronic record for the specified person; and
a password of the specified person assigned or approved under subsection (4).

subsection.content: The Commissioner of Police may, for enabling a person to send an electronic record under subsection (1)(b), assign or approve any sequence or combination of letters, characters, numbers or symbols as the person’s password.

A person whose digital signature has been affixed on the electronic record under subsection (3)(b)(i) is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, to be regarded as a person who is authorized by the specified person to send the record for the specified person.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: digital signature (數碼簽署) means a digital signature within the meaning of section 2 of the ETO that meets the requirements specified in section 63D.

section.name: s63D
section.heading: Requirements specified for digital signature under section 63C(6)

subsection.leadIn: The requirements specified for the definition of digital signature in section 63C(6) are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the digital signature is supported by a recognized certificate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the digital signature is generated within the validity of the certificate; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the digital signature is used in accordance with the terms of that certificate.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: certification authority (核證機關) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the ETO;
recognized certificate (認可證書) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the ETO;

within the validity of the certificate (在該證書的有效期內) means that at the time the digital signature is generated—(a)the certificate that supports the digital signature has not been revoked or suspended by the certification authority that issued the certificate;(b)the recognition of the certificate has not been revoked or suspended by the Government Chief Information Officer;(c)if it is a certificate designated as a recognized certificate issued by the recognized certification authority referred to in section 34 of the ETO—the designation has not been withdrawn by the certification authority;(d)if the Government Chief Information Officer has specified a period of validity for the recognition of the certificate—the certificate is within that period; and(e)if the recognized certification authority has specified a period of validity for the certificate—the certificate is within that period.

subsection.content: In proceedings for an offence under section 63B(5) or (6), a certificate of service in the specified form purporting to be signed by or for the Commissioner of Police is admissible in evidence without further proof on its production.

subsection.leadIn: The certificate may state the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the demand notice specified in the certificate has been served on the person on whom the demand under section 63(2) was made by post under section 63A(1)(b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the demand notice specified in the certificate has been made available for inspection by the person on whom the demand under section 63(2) was made under section 63A(3)(a) and the corresponding electronic message has been sent under section 63A(3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: Unless the contrary is proved—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is presumed that the certificate is signed by or for the Commissioner of Police; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certificate is evidence of the facts stated in it.

section.name: s63F
section.heading: Commissioner of Police may specify forms of certain documents

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner of Police may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify the forms of the following documents—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a demand notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an electronic message; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a certificate of service.

subsection.content: The Commissioner of Police may, in a form specified under subsection (1)(a), specify the form for the provision of information under section 63B(4)(a).

A demand notice in the form specified under subsection (1)(a) is valid if the name of the Commissioner of Police or a police officer authorized by the Commissioner of Police is printed, signed or otherwise shown on the notice.
A notice published in the Gazette under subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: certificate of service (送達證明書) means the certificate of service under section 63E(1).

section.name: s63G
section.heading: Designation of information system by Commissioner of Police

subsection.content: The Commissioner of Police may, by notice published in the Gazette, designate an information system for the purposes of section 63A(3)(a) or 63C(1)(b).
A notice published in the Gazette under subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Proof in summary proceedings of identity of driver

subsection.leadIn: If, in any summary proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance, there is produced to the court a written statement that— (Amended 13 of 2024 s. 57)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: purports to have been signed by the defendant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was provided in accordance with a notice served on the defendant under section 63A(1) or (3); and (Amended 13 of 2024 s. 57)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: states that the defendant was the driver of the vehicle at the time of the offence,

section.continued: the court must, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, admit the statement as evidence that the defendant was the driver of the vehicle at the time of the offence. (Amended 13 of 2024 s. 57)

subsection.content: Subsection (3) applies if the defendant concerned has provided, in accordance with a notice served on the defendant under section 63A(1) or (3), a statement in the form of an electronic record (electronic record) that purports to have been signed and sent by the defendant under section 63C(1). (Added 13 of 2024 s. 57)

If, in any summary proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance, there is produced to the court a printed copy of an electronic record (printed copy) that falls within the description under subsection (5) stating that the defendant was the driver of the vehicle at the time of the offence, the court must, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, admit the printed copy as evidence that the defendant was the driver of the vehicle at the time of the offence. (Added 13 of 2024 s. 57)
Subsections (5) and (6) apply in relation to a printed copy produced to the court under subsection (3). (Added 13 of 2024 s. 57)

subsection.leadIn: A document purporting to be a printed copy is admissible in evidence without further proof on its production before the court if the document purports to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a printed copy of an electronic record concerned produced from the information system under section 63C(1)(b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certified as being such a copy by or for the Commissioner of Police. (Added 13 of 2024 s. 57)

subsection.leadIn: If a document is produced under subsection (3) as a printed copy, the court before which the document is produced must, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, presume that the document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a true copy of the electronic record concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was certified by or for the Commissioner of Police under subsection (5)(b). (Added 13 of 2024 s. 57)

section.name: s64A
section.heading: Presumption of identity of signatory of electronic record signed and sent under section 63C(1)

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a police officer has demanded a person (subject person) to provide any information under section 63(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the subject person provided the information in the form of an electronic record signed and sent under section 63C(1) (electronic record).

subsection.content: The person named in an electronic record as the person who signed the record is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, to be regarded as the person who signed the record.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Provision of weigh-bridges and weighing of motor vehicles etc.

subsection.content: The Commissioner and the Commissioner of Police may maintain and operate weigh-bridges or other machines for weighing vehicles. [cf. 1972 c. 20 s. 200(1) U.K.]

Subject to the provisions of any other enactment, any police officer in uniform or the Commissioner may require the person in charge of any motor vehicle to allow the motor vehicle or any trailer drawn thereby to be weighed, either laden or unladen, and the weight transmitted to the road by any part of the motor vehicle or trailer in contact with the road to be tested, and for that purpose to proceed with the vehicle and such trailer (if any) to a weigh-bridge or other machine for weighing vehicles.

Where a motor vehicle or trailer is weighed under this section and the weight is found to be within the limits authorized by law, a certificate of weight shall be given to the person in charge of the motor vehicle and the certificate so given shall exempt the motor vehicle and the trailer, if any, from being weighed so long as it is during the continuance of the same journey carrying the same load.

Any person in charge of a motor vehicle who fails to comply with any requirement under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable in the case of a first conviction therefor to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months and in the case of a second or subsequent conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

section.name: s66
section.heading: Power to test for excessive smoke

subsection.content: A police officer in uniform of the rank of sergeant or above who has reason to believe that an offence relating to the emission of smoke or visible vapour is being or has been committed in respect of a motor vehicle which is on a road or in any public place may stop and examine the vehicle, and may measure or cause to be measured by means of prescribed apparatus the emission of smoke or visible vapour from the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: A police officer of the rank of sergeant or above who has reason to believe that an offence against this Ordinance relating to the emission of smoke or visible vapour has been committed within the preceding 14 days may by notice in writing served personally or by post on the owner of the vehicle require production of the vehicle at such vehicle examination centre or police station on such date and at such time as may be specified in the notice for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: measurement of the emission of smoke or visible vapour by means of prescribed apparatus; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: examination of the vehicle to ascertain whether its condition remains such that its use results in the commission of an offence against this Ordinance relating to the emission of smoke or visible vapour.

subsection.content: An owner served with a notice under subsection (2) who fails without reasonable excuse to produce the vehicle on the date and at the time and place specified in the notice commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

section.name: s67
section.heading: Power to seize document, vehicle licence or registration mark

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: This section applies in relation to an item that is mentioned in section 111(2)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f). (Added 26 of 2025 s. 7)

If a police officer has reasonable cause to believe that a document produced to him pursuant to the provisions of this Ordinance or any requirement made thereunder is a document in relation to which an offence has been committed under section 111, he may seize the document; and when a document is seized under this subsection, the person from whom it is taken shall, unless the document has been previously returned to him or he has been previously charged with an offence under section 111, be summoned before a court or magistrate to account for his possession of the said document and the court or magistrate shall make such order regarding the disposal of the document and award such costs as the justice of the case may require. [cf. 1972 c. 20 s. 173(1) U.K.]

If a police officer has reasonable cause to believe that a document, vehicle licence or registration mark carried on a motor vehicle or by the driver thereof is a document, vehicle licence or registration mark in relation to which an offence has been committed under section 111, he may seize the document, vehicle licence or registration mark and when a document, vehicle licence or registration mark is seized under this subsection either the driver or the owner of the vehicle shall, if the document, vehicle licence or registration mark is still detained and neither of them has previously been charged with an offence in relation thereto under this Ordinance, be summoned before a court or magistrate to account for his possession of, or the presence on the vehicle of, the said document, vehicle licence or registration mark and the court or magistrate shall make such order respecting the disposal of the said document, vehicle licence or registration mark and award such costs as the justice of the case may require. [cf. 1972 c. 20 s. 173(2) U.K.]
For the purposes of this section the power to seize includes power to detach from a vehicle. [cf. 1972 c. 20 s. 173(2) U.K.]

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: fitted EDRD (已裝配電子數據記錄儀) has the meaning given to it by regulation 2 of the Road Traffic (Construction and Maintenance of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. A); (Amended 20 of 2021 s. 79)
tag device (繳費貼裝置) means a toll tag or any device that functions in a manner similar to a toll tag; (Added 20 of 2021 s. 79)

tag-related offence (繳費貼相關罪行) means—(a)an offence under section 111A;(b)an offence under a regulation made under section 6A; or(c)an offence that—(i)is an offence under the Road Tunnels (Government) Ordinance (Cap. 368) or the Tsing Sha Control Area Ordinance (Cap. 594); and(ii)involves the tampering of, interference with, unauthorized access or damage to, or defacement or alteration of, any installation, facility, equipment, appliance, system, record or information that relates to the collection and recovery of tolls for the use of any specified Government infrastructure as defined by section 6A(5) in so far as it is operated without toll booths. (Added 20 of 2021 s. 79)

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a motor vehicle with a fitted EDRD; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a motor vehicle in connection with which a tag device is used or on which a tag device is carried. (Replaced 20 of 2021 s. 79)

subsection.leadIn: During any examination of a motor vehicle specified in subsection (3A), the Commissioner may cause to be retrieved by a vehicle examiner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any data stored in the fitted EDRD with the motor vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any data stored in the tag device used in connection with or carried on the motor vehicle. (Replaced 20 of 2021 s. 79)

subsection.leadIn: The examination of a motor vehicle is one that is carried out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under section 78; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under an examination order served or caused to be served by the Commissioner or a police officer, under section 79. (Added 20 of 2021 s. 79)

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (4) and (5) apply if a police officer has reasonable cause to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a motor vehicle with a fitted EDRD has been involved in an accident or any offence under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a tag device used in connection with or carried on a motor vehicle has been involved with a tag-related offence. (Added 20 of 2021 s. 79)

subsection.leadIn: The police officer may— (Amended 20 of 2021 s. 79)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if there is a driver or any other person inside the vehicle—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: direct the driver to drive it to the vehicle examination centre or police station specified by the police officer; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: direct the driver and any other person to leave the vehicle and himself or herself drive or remove the vehicle or cause it to be driven or removed to any vehicle examination centre or police station; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is no person inside the vehicle, drive or remove the vehicle or cause it to be driven or removed to any vehicle examination centre or police station.

subsection.leadIn: The police officer referred to in subsection (4) may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause the vehicle to be detained at a vehicle examination centre or police station for not more than 72 hours; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: during the detention, cause to be retrieved by a vehicle examiner or any person authorized by the Commissioner of Police (as the case requires)—

paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (3B)(a), any data stored in the fitted EDRD; or
in the case of subsection (3B)(b), any data stored in the tag device. (Replaced 20 of 2021 s. 79)

subsection.content: In any criminal proceedings, a document purporting to be a record of the data retrieved under subsection (5)(b) is admissible as evidence of the matters appearing from the record without further proof.
Any person who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with any direction of a police officer under subsection (4)(a) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Notice of intention to prosecute for certain offences

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a person prosecuted for an offence under section 36, 36A, 37, 38 or 41 (which relate respectively to causing death by dangerous driving, causing grievous bodily harm by dangerous driving, dangerous driving, careless driving and driving in excess of the speed limit) shall not be convicted of such offence unless— (Amended 33 of 2000 s. 5; 19 of 2010 s. 17)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he was warned at the time of the commission of the offence or within 24 hours thereafter that the question of prosecuting him under some one or other of the provisions aforesaid would be taken into consideration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 14 days of the commission of the offence, either he was charged before a magistrate or a summons in respect thereof was served on him; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: within 14 days, excluding public holidays, of the commission of the offence, a notice of the intended prosecution specifying the nature of the alleged offence and the time and place where it is alleged to have been committed was served on him, or sent by registered post to him, or served on or sent by registered post to the person in whose name the vehicle was registered at the time of the commission of the offence; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of an offence under section 41, the person was served with a demand notice under section 3AAB(1) or (2) of the Fixed Penalty (Criminal Proceedings) Ordinance (Cap. 240) and has failed to comply with the demand notice. (Amended 13 of 2024 s. 59)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply if it appears to the court or magistrate that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person prosecuted was not prejudiced in his defence by a failure to comply with that subsection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person prosecuted by his own conduct contributed to the failure to comply with that subsection.

subsection.content: The requirements of subsection (1) shall in every case be presumed to have been complied with unless and until the contrary is proved.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Disqualification on conviction of certain offences

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to any other provision relating to the penalty that may be, or is required to be, imposed for an offence, a court or magistrate before which a person is convicted of any of the following offences may order him to be disqualified for such period as the court or magistrate thinks fit— (Amended 23 of 2008 s. 16)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any offence under this Ordinance in connection with the driving of a motor vehicle; (Amended 43 of 1986 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an offence under section 63B(5) or (6); (Amended 13 of 2024 s. 60)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: stealing a motor vehicle;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an offence under section 14(1) of the Theft Ordinance (Cap. 210) in respect of a motor vehicle;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an offence under section 27 of the Theft Ordinance (Cap. 210) committed with reference to the theft or taking of motor vehicles;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a contravention of any of the following provisions of the Road Traffic (Public Service Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. D), namely regulation 37(a), (b), (c) and (d) (relating to the obligations of taxi drivers) and regulation 47 (relating to prescribed taxi fares); (Replaced 66 of 1984 s. 9)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any offence under any regulation made under section 9 of using or causing or permitting the use on a road of any motor vehicle or trailer in contravention of any provision or requirement of any such regulation as to brakes, tyres or steering gear, except where the convicted person proves that he did not know and had no reasonable cause to suspect that the facts of the case were such that the offence would have been committed;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: any offence during the course of which, or in order to escape apprehension for which, he uses a motor vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: A disqualification—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: imposed in respect of an offence specified in subsection (1)(f), shall be limited to the driving of a taxi; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: imposed in respect of any other offence specified in subsection (1) shall be a disqualification from holding or obtaining any driving licence. (Replaced 43 of 1986 s. 3)

subsection.content: When a person is convicted of aiding, abetting, counselling or procuring or inciting the commission of an offence under Part 5 or section 52(1), and it is proved that he was present in the vehicle at the time of the commission of the offence, the offence of which he is convicted shall, for the purposes of this Ordinance, be deemed to be an offence in connection with the driving of a motor vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a court or magistrate convicts a person of a relevant scheduled offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conviction is the person’s second or subsequent conviction of a relevant scheduled offence, regardless of whether that conviction is for the same or for a different relevant scheduled offence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the court or magistrate sentences the person to undergo a term of imprisonment or detention and the sentence is not suspended; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the court or magistrate orders that the person be disqualified for a fixed period.

subsection.content: The court or magistrate must direct that the disqualification period is not to start to run until the person finishes serving the term of imprisonment or detention, or finishes serving any other term of imprisonment or detention which the person is undergoing at the time he or she finishes serving the first-mentioned term, or has been previously sentenced to undergo (whichever is the later), unless the court or magistrate for special reasons decides not to make such a direction. (Amended 24 of 2011 s. 15)

The court or magistrate may deal with the conviction of a relevant scheduled offence as a first conviction if, as at the date on which the offence was committed, at least 5 years have passed since the person’s last conviction of a relevant scheduled offence.

Subject to subsection (5), a person is disqualified by this section for the whole of any day during which or during part of which the person is released from custody before the disqualification period is to start to run by virtue of a direction given under subsection (2) and any such day must be deducted from the period of disqualification to be served by the person.

The court or magistrate may direct that a person is not disqualified by this section during any period of release from custody of a kind referred to in subsection (8)(a) (admission to bail pending sentence or appeal).

Subsection (4) ceases to operate if the period of disqualification becomes exhausted because of deductions made under that subsection. In such a case the disqualification period does not start to run in accordance with the direction of the court or magistrate and must be taken for all purposes to have been served.
For the purpose of subsection (6), each 30 days deducted under subsection (4) is to be treated as being equal to a month.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (4), a person must be taken to be released from custody for the purposes of this section during any period that he or she—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is, following his or her conviction of the relevant scheduled offence, admitted to bail pending sentence or appeal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is released from prison or detention on leave of absence granted under—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: section 12A of the Prisons Ordinance (Cap. 234);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: rule 17(1) of the Prison Rules (Cap. 234 sub. leg. A);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: regulation 14(1) of the Detention Centres Regulations (Cap. 239 sub. leg. A);

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: regulation 13(1) of the Drug Addiction Treatment Centres Regulations (Cap. 244 sub. leg. A);

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: regulation 18(1) of the Training Centres Regulations (Cap. 280 sub. leg. A); or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: section 17(1) of the Rehabilitation Centres Regulation (Cap. 567 sub. leg. A);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is released from imprisonment under section 7(1) or (2) of the Prisoners (Release under Supervision) Ordinance (Cap. 325);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is released under an order made under section 15(1)(b) of the Long-term Prison Sentences Review Ordinance (Cap. 524); or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: while undergoing a period of residence at a rehabilitation centre referred to in section 3(b) of the Rehabilitation Centres Ordinance (Cap. 567), is engaged in activities outside that centre under permission granted under section 5(1) of that Ordinance.

subsection.def: In this section relevant scheduled offence (有關表列罪行) means an offence mentioned in the Schedule to the Road Traffic (Driving-offence Points) Ordinance (Cap. 375) for which the number of points set out opposite that offence in that Schedule is 10.

subsection.content: Where a person is convicted of an offence involving obligatory or discretionary disqualification the court or magistrate may, whether or not it makes any other order as to disqualification, and whether or not such person has previously passed the test of competence to drive prescribed under this Ordinance, order him to be disqualified until he has, after the date of the order, passed that test. (Amended 23 of 2008 s. 17)

A disqualification by virtue of an order under subsection (2) shall be deemed to have expired on production to the Commissioner of evidence, in such form as may be prescribed under this Ordinance, that the person disqualified has, after the order was made, passed that test.

A person disqualified by virtue of an order under subsection (2) shall, unless he is disqualified otherwise than by virtue of such an order, be entitled to obtain and hold a learner’s driving licence and to drive a motor vehicle in accordance with the conditions subject to which the licence is granted.
This section does not apply if the court or magistrate makes an order that a person be disqualified for life. (Added 24 of 2011 s. 16)

section.name: s71
section.heading: Notification and effect of, and appeal against, disqualification

subsection.leadIn: If a court or magistrate orders that a person be disqualified, the court or magistrate must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: immediately cause a notice of the conviction and order to be sent to the Commissioner and the Commissioner of Police; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if on the date of the conviction or order the person holds a driving licence, an international driving permit, a domestic driving permit or a domestic driving licence—cause the licence or permit to be forwarded to the Commissioner as soon as it is deposited with the court or magistrate in accordance with subsection (2). (Replaced 26 of 2025 s. 8)

content.leadIn: If a court or magistrate orders that a person be disqualified and at the date of such order the person holds a driving licence, an international driving permit, a domestic driving permit or a domestic driving licence, the court or magistrate must also order the person to deposit it with the court or magistrate within 5 days of the date of the order or such longer period as the court or magistrate may determine:
content.proviso: Provided that if such person gives notice of appeal against the order such period of 5 days is to commence at the determination of the appeal if the appeal is dismissed. (Amended 26 of 2025 s. 8)

subsection.content: Where a person who is disqualified by virtue of a conviction or order is the holder of a driving licence, an international driving permit, a domestic driving licence or a domestic driving permit, the licence or permit shall, subject to section 70(4), be of no effect so long as the disqualification continues in force.

A person who is disqualified by virtue of the order of a court or magistrate may appeal against the disqualification in like manner as if it were an order made against him for the payment of a penal or other sum and the court or magistrate which made the order may order the operation of the disqualification to be suspended pending the appeal and if that court or magistrate refuses to order such suspension, the court or magistrate to which the appeal lies may do so.

Any person who fails to comply with an order made under subsection (2) for the deposit of a driving licence, international driving permit, domestic driving permit or domestic driving licence, commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 1 month. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

A person who by virtue of the order of a court or magistrate is disqualified other than under section 70(2) may at any time apply for an order removing the disqualification, and on any such application the court or magistrate may, having regard to the character of the person disqualified and his conduct subsequent to the order, the nature of the offence and any other circumstances of the case, either refuse the application or remove the disqualification as from such date, subject to subsection (2), as may be specified in the order. (Amended 43 of 1986 s. 5; 23 of 2008 s. 19)

In the case of an offence for which a minimum period of disqualification is specified by this Ordinance, the date from which a disqualification may be removed under subsection (1) shall not be a date earlier than the date of expiration of such period, disregarding any time after the conviction or order for disqualification during which the disqualification was suspended or the applicant was not disqualified.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1) shall be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the disqualification was imposed by the Court of First Instance, to the Court of First Instance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the disqualification was imposed by the District Court, to the Court of First Instance or District Court;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the disqualification was imposed by a magistrate, to the Court of First Instance, the District Court or any magistrate. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.content: When an application under subsection (1) is refused, no further application thereunder shall be entertained which is made less than 3 months after the date of the refusal or, as the case may be, the last refusal.
An application under subsection (1) shall not be heard unless not less than 14 days’ notice in writing setting forth the grounds of the application has been given to the Commissioner of Police.

A court or magistrate which orders a disqualification to be removed shall cause notice of the order to be sent to the Commissioner and to the Commissioner of Police and may in any case order the applicant to pay the whole or any part of the costs of the application. (Amended 23 of 2008 s. 19)

section.name: s72A
section.heading: Power of court or magistrate to order attendance of improvement courses

subsection.leadIn: Where a court or magistrate convicts a person of a specified general offence or a specified taxi offence, the court or magistrate may do either or both of the following— (Amended 23 of 2008 s. 20; 35 of 2023 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impose any penalty that may be imposed for the offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: order the person to attend and complete— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)

subparagraph.content: for a specified general offence—a driving improvement course; and
for a specified taxi offence—a taxi service improvement course. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Subject to subsection (1B), where a court or magistrate convicts a person of an offence under section 36, 36A, 37, 39, 39A, 39B, 39C, 39J, 39K, 39L, 39O(1), 39S or 55, or convicts an applicable person of an offence under section 41(1), the court or magistrate shall order the person to attend and complete a driving improvement course, unless the court or magistrate for special reasons decides not to make such an order. (Added 23 of 2008 s. 20. Amended 19 of 2010 s. 19; 24 of 2011 s. 17)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content:
If a person, on being convicted of a specified general offence in any proceedings, is ordered under subsection (1)(b) or (1A) to attend and complete a driving improvement course, the person is not to be ordered under that subsection to attend and complete a driving improvement course for any other specified general offence the person is convicted of in the same proceedings.
(Added 23 of 2008 s. 20. Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: If a person, on being convicted of a specified taxi offence in any proceedings, is ordered under subsection (1)(b) to attend and complete a taxi service improvement course, the person is not to be ordered under that subsection to attend and complete a taxi service improvement course for any other specified taxi offence the person is convicted of in the same proceedings. (Added 35 of 2023 s. 48)

Where a court or magistrate makes an order under subsection (1)(b) in addition to imposing a penalty under subsection (1)(a), the penalty so imposed may be a penalty that is lighter than the court or magistrate might have imposed had the order not been made. (Amended 23 of 2008 s. 20)

subsection.leadIn: A person who is— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ordered under subsection (1)(b) or (1A) to attend and complete a driving improvement course; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ordered under subsection (1)(b) to attend and complete a taxi service improvement course,

subsection.continued: must, at the person’s own cost, attend and complete that course in accordance with subsection (3A), (3B) or (3C) as may be applicable to the person. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: The person must attend and complete the course within 3 months beginning on the date of the order for attending and completing it if the person— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has not been ordered to serve a term of imprisonment or detention and is not the subject of a disqualification order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not been ordered to serve a term of imprisonment or detention, but is the subject of a disqualification order with a disqualification period of less than 3 months. (Replaced 24 of 2011 s. 17)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.leadIn: The person must attend and complete the course within the last 3 months of the disqualification period if the person— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: has been ordered to serve a term of imprisonment or detention and is also the subject of a disqualification order with a disqualification period that ends after a period of 3 months or more beginning on the date the person finishes serving that term. (Replaced 24 of 2011 s. 17)

subsection.name: 3C
subsection.leadIn: The person must attend and complete the course within 3 months beginning on the date the person finishes serving the term of imprisonment or detention if the person— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been ordered to serve a term of imprisonment or detention, but is not the subject of a disqualification order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: has been ordered to serve a term of imprisonment or detention and is also the subject of a disqualification order with a disqualification period that ends—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: before the person finishes serving that term; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: within a period of less than 3 months beginning on the date the person finishes serving that term. (Added 24 of 2011 s. 17)

subsection.content: Where a judge or magistrate considers, on application made by a person in accordance with subsection (5), that the person has reasonable grounds for not attending and completing a driving improvement course or taxi service improvement course within the compliance period, the judge or magistrate may order that the compliance period be extended for such period as the judge or magistrate considers appropriate. (Amended 23 of 2008 s. 20; 24 of 2011 s. 17; 35 of 2023 s. 48)

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (4) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: where the order referred to in subsection (1)(b) or (1A) is made by a magistrate, made in writing to a magistrate and sent to the magistrates’ clerk. (Amended 23 of 2008 s. 20)

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a judge makes an order under subsection (4), the Registrar;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a magistrate makes an order under subsection (4), the magistrates’ clerk,

subsection.continued: shall give notice of the order to the person who made the application and the Commissioner.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 1 month. (Amended 23 of 2008 s. 20; 24 of 2011 s. 17)

subsection.name: 9A
subsection.leadIn: If a court or magistrate convicts a person of an offence under subsection (9), the court or magistrate must— (Added 23 of 2008 s. 20. Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a failure to comply with subsection (3) in respect of a driving improvement course—order the person to attend and complete a driving improvement course at the person’s own cost within the period specified in the order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a failure to comply with subsection (3) in respect of a taxi service improvement course—order the person to attend and complete a taxi service improvement course at the person’s own cost within the period specified in the order,

subsection.continued: unless the court or magistrate for special reasons decides not to make such an order. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)

subsection.name: 9B
subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with the order made under subsection (9A) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 2 months. (Added 23 of 2008 s. 20)

subsection.name: 9C
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a court or magistrate convicts a person of an offence under subsection (9B) for a failure to comply with an order made under subsection (9A)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is not yet disqualified,

subsection.continued: the court or magistrate must make an order (subsection (9C) order) that the person be disqualified for a period of not less than 3 months beginning on the date of the subsection (9C) order or until the person has attended and completed a driving improvement course at the person’s own cost, whichever is the later, unless the court or magistrate for special reasons orders that the person be disqualified for a shorter period or that the person not be disqualified. (Replaced 35 of 2023 s. 48)

subsection.name: 9CA
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a court or magistrate convicts a person of an offence under subsection (9B) for a failure to comply with an order made under subsection (9A)(b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is not yet disqualified from driving a taxi,

subsection.continued: the court or magistrate must make an order (subsection (9CA) order) that the person be disqualified from driving a taxi for a period of not less than 3 months beginning on the date of the subsection (9CA) order or until the person has attended and completed a taxi service improvement course at the person’s own cost, whichever is the later, unless the court or magistrate for special reasons orders that the person be so disqualified for a shorter period or that the person not be so disqualified. (Added 35 of 2023 s. 48)

subsection.name: 9D
subsection.content: If a person is ordered under subsection (1)(b), (1A) or (9A) to attend and complete a course, the person may appeal against the order in like manner as if it were an order made against the person for the payment of a fine. (Added 23 of 2008 s. 20. Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)

subsection.name: 9E
subsection.content: If a person appeals against an order under subsection (9D), the compliance period, or that period as extended under subsection (4), or, in relation to an order made under subsection (9A), the period specified in the order does not commence or continue to run, as the case may be, until the appeal is withdrawn or dismissed. (Added 23 of 2008 s. 20. Amended 24 of 2011 s. 17)
The Legislative Council may by resolution amend Schedule 11.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: compliance period (遵從限期) means, in relation to a person who has been ordered under subsection (1)(b) or (1A) to attend and complete a driving improvement course or taxi service improvement course, the period specified in subsection (3A), (3B) or (3C) for attending and completing that course, as may be applicable to the person; (Replaced 24 of 2011 s. 17. Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)

disqualification order (停牌令)— (Added 24 of 2011 s. 17. Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)(a)in relation to an order to attend and complete a driving improvement course made under subsection (1)(b) or (1A)—means an order made under section 36(2), 36A(2), 37(2), 39(2), 39A(2), 39B(7), 39C(16), 39J(2), 39K(2), 39L(2), 39O(4), 39S(3), 41(3), 55(2) or 69(1)(a) that a person be disqualified; and(b)in relation to an order to attend and complete a taxi service improvement course made under subsection (1)(b)—means an order made under section 69(1)(f) that a person be disqualified from driving a taxi; ( Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)

disqualification period (停牌期) means, in relation to a disqualification order in which the court or magistrate has specified the period for which the convicted person is to be disqualified with reference to a fixed period and the completion of a course, the fixed period; (Added 24 of 2011 s. 17. Amended 35 of 2023 s.48)

def.name: Judge
def.leadIn: judge (法官) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in relation to the District Court, a District Judge and a deputy District Judge;

def.name: Registrar
def.leadIn: Registrar (司法常務官) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to proceedings in the Court of First Instance, the Registrar of the High Court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to proceedings in the District Court, the Registrar of the District Court; (Amended 24 of 2011 s. 17)

subsection.def: specified general offence (指明一般罪行) means an offence specified in Schedule 11; (Added 35 of 2023 s. 48)
specified taxi offence (指明的士罪行) means a scheduled offence as defined by section 2(1) of the Taxi-Driver-Offence Points Ordinance (Cap. 647); (Added 35 of 2023 s. 48. Amended E.R. 5 of 2024)

def.name: TermOfImprisonmentOrDetention
def.leadIn: term of imprisonment or detention (監禁或拘留刑期) means a period of deprivation of liberty a person is ordered to undergo or is undergoing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction for an offence for which a disqualification order is made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction for any other offence. (Added 24 of 2011 s. 17)

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1A), a person is, in relation to an offence under section 41(1), an applicable person if it is proved or admitted that, at the time of the offence, the person was driving the vehicle at a speed exceeding the relevant speed limit as described in that section by more than 45 km an hour. (Added 23 of 2008 s. 20)

For the purposes of subsection (9C), a person is disqualified for a shorter period if the person is disqualified for a period of less than 3 months beginning on the date of the subsection (9C) order or until the person has attended and completed a driving improvement course at the person’s own cost, whichever is the later. (Added 23 of 2008 s. 20. Amended 35 of 2023 s. 48)

subsection.name: 13A
subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (9CA), a person is disqualified for a shorter period if the person is disqualified for a period of less than 3 months beginning on the date of the subsection (9CA) order or until the person has attended and completed a taxi service improvement course at the person’s own cost, whichever is the later. (Added 35 of 2023 s. 48)

The requirement in subsection (1A) to order a person to attend and complete a driving improvement course does not apply if the court or magistrate makes an order that the person be disqualified for life. (Added 24 of 2011 s. 17)

In any proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance, a certificate in the form set out in Form 1 of Schedule 2 purporting to be signed by a police officer and certifying that a plan or drawing exhibited thereto is a plan or drawing made by him of the place or object specified in the certificate, and that the plan or drawing is correctly drawn to a scale so specified, shall be admissible as evidence of the relative positions of the things shown on the plan or drawing.

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance, a certificate in the form set out in Form 2 of Schedule 2 purporting to be signed by a police officer and certifying that a person specified in the certificate stated to the police officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that a particular motor vehicle was being driven or used by, or belonged to, that person on a particular occasion; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that a particular motor vehicle on a particular occasion was used by, or belonged to, a firm in which that person also stated that he was at the time of the statement a partner; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that a particular motor vehicle on a particular occasion was used by, or belonged to, a corporation of which that person also stated that he was at the time of the statement a director, officer or employee,

subsection.continued: shall be admissible as evidence for the purpose of determining by whom the vehicle was being driven or used, or to whom it belonged, as the case may be, on that occasion.

subsection.content: Nothing in subsection (1) or (2) shall be deemed to make a certificate admissible as evidence in proceedings for an offence except in a case where and to the like extent to which oral evidence to the like effect would have been admissible in those proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in subsection (1) or (2) shall be deemed to make a certificate admissible as evidence in proceedings for an offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless a copy thereof has, not less than 7 days before the hearing or trial, been served on the person charged with the offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that person, not later than 3 days before the hearing or trial or within such further time as the court may in special circumstances allow, serves a notice in the form set out in Form 3 of Schedule 2 on the prosecutor requiring attendance at the trial of the person who signed the certificate.

subsection.leadIn: A certificate or other document required by subsection (4) to be served on any person may be served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering it personally to the person to be served, or by addressing it to him and leaving it at, or sending it by registered post to his last or usual place of abode or place of business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a body corporate, by delivering it to the secretary or clerk of the body at its registered or principal office or by sending it by registered post addressed to the secretary or clerk of that body at that office.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Certificate as to registered owner of vehicle or holder of driving licence

subsection.leadIn: A document purporting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be signed by or on behalf of the Commissioner or the Commissioner of Police; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to certify—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that according to the register of motor vehicles maintained under this Ordinance a person specified in the certificate was registered as the owner of a motor vehicle specified therein; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that according to the register of driving licences maintained under this Ordinance a person specified in the certificate was the holder of a driving licence specified therein,

subsection.continued: shall be admitted in any civil or criminal proceedings before any court on its production without further proof.

subsection.leadIn: On the production of a document under subsection (1), the court before which it is produced shall, until the contrary is proved, presume—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that it was signed at the time specified therein by a person duly authorized by the Commissioner or the Commissioner of Police as the case may be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a certificate under subsection (1)(b)(i), the person specified in the certificate was at any time specified therein the registered owner of the motor vehicle specified therein; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a certificate referred to in subsection (1)(b)(ii), that the person specified in the certificate was the holder of the driving licence specified therein,

subsection.continued: and the certificate shall be prima facie evidence of all the matters contained therein.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Proof of matters relating to previous convictions

subsection.leadIn: A document purporting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be signed by or on behalf of the Commissioner of Police; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to certify that according to the record of convictions for offences under this Ordinance compiled and maintained by the Commissioner of Police under this section a person having the name, and holding the driving licence, specified in the certificate is recorded as having on the date specified in the certificate been convicted of the offence under this Ordinance specified in the certificate,

subsection.continued: shall be admitted in any criminal proceedings before any court on its production without further proof.

subsection.leadIn: On the production of a document under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the court shall, until the contrary is proved, presume that the document was signed at the time specified therein by or on behalf of the Commissioner of Police; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the document shall be evidence that the person having the name and holding the driving licence specified in the document was on the date so specified convicted of the offence so specified.

subsection.content: The Commissioner of Police may, for the purposes of this section, cause to be compiled and maintained from information obtained from such persons and in such manner as the Commissioner of Police shall determine records of conviction of persons for offences under this Ordinance.

Any records of convictions of persons for offences under this Ordinance compiled and maintained by the Commissioner of Police prior to the commencement of this section shall be deemed to be records compiled and kept under this section.

Subject to subsection (5A), the Commissioner of Police shall, on payment of the prescribed fee and receipt of the completed application form for a record or certificate under this section, issue to the holder of a driving licence a record of all convictions of offences under this Ordinance or payments or orders to pay under the Fixed Penalty (Criminal Proceedings) Ordinance (Cap. 240) recorded in respect of that person or, where it appears from records maintained by the Commissioner of Police that such person has not been convicted of an offence under this Ordinance, a certificate to that effect. (Amended 66 of 1987 s. 3; 80 of 1991 s. 2; 10 of 1996 s. 9)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: The Commissioner of Police shall not issue the record or certificate to the person under subsection (5) unless he is satisfied that all fines, fixed penalties, additional penalties and costs ordered by the court or magistrate to be paid by the holder of a driving licence under the Fixed Penalty (Traffic Contraventions) Ordinance (Cap. 237) or the Fixed Penalty (Criminal Proceedings) Ordinance (Cap. 240) have been paid. (Added 80 of 1991 s. 2)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, a record issued under subsection (5) may, at the written request of the applicant, reveal all convictions under this Ordinance or payments or orders to pay under the Fixed Penalty (Criminal Proceedings) Ordinance (Cap. 240), notwithstanding the provisions of the Rehabilitation of Offenders Ordinance (Cap. 297). (Added 10 of 1996 s. 9)

Neither the Government nor any public officer shall be subject to any action, liability, claim or demand whatsoever arising out of compliance with, or any failure to comply in any respect with, subsection (5).

A document issued under this section may contain an extract from the register of taxi-driver-offence points maintained under section 3(1) of the Taxi-Driver-Offence Points Ordinance (Cap. 647) (TDOP Register). (Added 35 of 2023 s. 49. Amended E.R. 5 of 2024)

This section applies to an extract from the TDOP Register as if the extract were a record of convictions compiled and maintained by the Commissioner of Police under this section. (Added 35 of 2023 s. 49)
