subsection.leadIn: Unless otherwise specifically provided by this Ordinance, any notice required to be served under this Ordinance may be served by sending it by post—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where it is directed to a registered owner, to his registered address; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where it is directed to a driver, to his last known postal address.

subsection.leadIn: A certificate of posting in the prescribed form purporting to be signed by or for the Commissioner or the Commissioner of Police, as the case may be, shall be admitted in evidence on its production without further proof and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: until the contrary is proved, it shall be presumed that the certificate is so signed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it shall be conclusively presumed that the notice to which the certificate relates was duly served.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Exemptions of fire engines, etc. from speed limits and traffic lights

subsection.content: The provisions of any enactment imposing a speed limit on motor vehicles shall not apply to any vehicle on an occasion when it is being used for fire services, ambulance, customs and excise service or police purposes, if compliance with those provisions would be likely to hinder the use of the vehicle on that occasion for any of those purposes.

The provisions of any enactment imposing control by traffic lights or traffic signs on motor vehicles shall not apply to any motor vehicle on an occasion when it is being used for police, fire services or ambulance purposes, so long as the approach of the vehicle to the traffic lights or traffic sign, as the case may be, is indicated by the sounding of a gong, bell or siren and if compliance with those provisions would be likely to hinder the use of the vehicle on that occasion for any of those purposes.
Nothing in this section shall affect any civil claim for injury or damage to a person or to property.

section.name: s77A
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part and Schedule 10, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: certificate of compliance (合格證明書) means a certificate issued by a vehicle emission testing centre in the form specified by the Commissioner in respect of a motor vehicle and indicating that the motor vehicle was found to comply with vehicle emission standards upon testing at the vehicle emission testing centre;
code of practice (實務守則) means a code of practice issued and from time to time revised under section 77F(1)(a);
proprietor (東主), in relation to a vehicle emission testing centre, means a person having the conduct or control of it, whether or not he is a natural person and whether or not he is the owner;
responsible person (負責人) means a person authorized in writing by the Commissioner under section 77F(1)(e);
test (測試) means a vehicle emission test in accordance with a code of practice and testing (測試) shall be construed accordingly;
vehicle emission testing centre (車輛廢氣測試中心) means a place designated as a vehicle emission testing centre under section 77C(1).

section.name: s77B
section.heading: Compliance with vehicle emission standards
section.content: The Commissioner may, for the purpose of ascertaining whether a motor vehicle complies with vehicle emission standards, require the registered owner to have the motor vehicle tested at a vehicle emission testing centre.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, in writing, designate any place (including any place designated under section 88C as a car testing centre or any place designated as a vehicle examination centre) as a vehicle emission testing centre and may impose such conditions relating to that designation as he thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: Where a place is designated as a vehicle emission testing centre under subsection (1), such designation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall authorize the person specified in the designation as the proprietor of that place, to operate that place as a vehicle emission testing centre in accordance with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a code of practice;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: Schedule 10; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: such conditions as may be specified by the Commissioner in the designation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be valid except on payment of the fee specified in paragraph 6(a) of Schedule 10.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (2)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fee specified in paragraph 6(b) of Schedule 10 shall be payable by the registered owner of a motor vehicle to the proprietor of a vehicle emission testing centre in respect of a test carried out under this Part;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the conditions that may be specified in a designation under subsection (2)(a)(iii) may include conditions relating to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the supply by the Commissioner to the proprietor specified in the designation of any document or form to be used for the purposes of this Part; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the fee as specified in paragraph 6(c) of Schedule 10, payable by that proprietor in respect of such supply and the refund of such fee.

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall cause notice of the designation of a place as a vehicle emission testing centre to be published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 77D, a designation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be valid for a period of 3 years from such date as shall be specified in the designation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, on application made to the Commissioner not less than 6 months before the date of its expiration and on payment of the fee specified in paragraph 6(a) of Schedule 10, be renewed in writing by the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: A renewal of a designation under subsection (5) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not be valid except on payment of the fee specified in paragraph 6(a) of Schedule 10; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be valid for a period of 3 years from such date as the Commissioner shall specify in the renewal.

subsection.leadIn: If in the case of any proprietor of a vehicle emission testing centre it appears to the Commissioner that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: there has been a breach of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a code of practice as it affects the operation of that centre;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: Schedule 10;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the conditions specified in the designation under section 77C; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certificates of compliance have been improperly issued; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: certificates of compliance have been incorrectly dated for fraudulent purposes; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the proprietor has ceased to trade, or is being wound up or grounds exist for a creditor to present a bankruptcy petition against him, (Amended 37 of 1998 s. 6)

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may serve on the proprietor a notice stating his intention to revoke the designation and the ground or grounds therefor and requiring the proprietor to show cause in writing, within 28 days after the service of such notice, why the designation should not be so revoked.

subsection.leadIn: Where after a notice is served on a proprietor under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proprietor does not show cause why the designation should not be revoked; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner, having considered any representations made by the proprietor, is of the opinion that the proprietor has not shown good cause why the designation should not be revoked,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may, by notice in writing served on the proprietor, revoke the designation with effect from such date being not less than 14 days after service of the notice as he shall specify in the notice.

subsection.content: Any proprietor of a vehicle emission testing centre aggrieved by a decision of the Commissioner under subsection (2) to revoke the designation of such vehicle emission testing centre may appeal to a Transport Tribunal against such decision within 14 days of receiving notice of the decision and on any such appeal a Transport Tribunal may affirm, amend or reverse such decision.
A decision of the Commissioner appealed against under subsection (3) shall not have effect pending the determination of the appeal by a Transport Tribunal.
The Commissioner shall cause notice of the revocation of a designation under subsection (2) to be published in the Gazette as soon as practicable after the revocation has come into effect.
No compensation shall be payable in respect of the revocation of a designation under this section.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding section 77D, a designation in respect of a vehicle emission testing centre shall be terminated in the following cases—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the Commissioner serves written notice on the proprietor of not less than 6 months, on the expiration of the period of such notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the proprietor serves written notice on the Commissioner of not less than 3 months, on the expiration of the period of such notice.

subsection.content: Where a designation is terminated under this section, the Commissioner may make a refund in respect of any fee paid under section 77C of an amount not exceeding the sum obtained by dividing the amount of the fee paid by 36 and multiplying the result by the number of months in the unexpired period of the designation.
The Commissioner shall cause a copy of every notice served under subsection (1) to be published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part the Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue and from time to time revise a code of practice setting out vehicle emission standards and the practice and procedure to be followed and specifying the equipment to be used for the testing of motor vehicles at vehicle emission testing centres;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify any form or other document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: conduct training courses for the purposes of paragraph (d);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: authorize in writing persons to act as approved vehicle emission testers who have attended and completed a training course conducted by the Commissioner for the purpose of training persons to be approved vehicle emission testers;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: authorize in writing persons to act as responsible persons at vehicle emission testing centres in respect of the supervision of tests of motor vehicles carried out under this Part.

subsection.content: A code of practice issued, and from time to time revised, under subsection (1) may specify the circumstances in which the fees set out in paragraph 6(a) or (b) of Schedule 10 are to be waived, reduced or refunded.

section.name: s77G
section.heading: Power to enter and inspect records, equipment, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Any public officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for the purposes of this section, may, during the hours when a vehicle emission testing centre is open for business, enter any vehicle emission testing centre and on production of his authorization—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect and take copies of any record, book or document kept or maintained in respect of the testing of motor vehicles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inspect or test any equipment used for the testing of motor vehicles; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: observe and monitor the testing of any motor vehicle.

subsection.content: Any person who obstructs an officer in the execution of his duty under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)
The Chief Executive may by order published in the Gazette amend Schedule 10. (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)
The Financial Secretary may by order published in the Gazette amend the fees set out in paragraph 6 of Schedule 10.

section.name: s77I
section.heading: Protection of Government and public officers
section.content: No proceedings in tort shall lie against the Government or any public officer by reason only of the fact that a place is designated as a vehicle emission testing centre under this Part.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Examination of vehicles in connection with registration etc.

subsection.leadIn: Before—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: registering a vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issuing a duplicate registration document to the registered owner of a vehicle;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: returning the registration document to a new registered owner;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: licensing a vehicle; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: entering in the register any alterations to a vehicle notified under this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may, by notice given in the manner provided in subsection (1A), require production of a vehicle of any class for examination at such vehicle examination centre as the Commissioner may determine for the purpose of ascertaining whether a vehicle—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: accords, as the case may be, with the particulars contained in the application for registration or for the vehicle licence or in the notice of transfer of ownership, or with the particulars contained in the register, or with the alterations notified under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: is roadworthy;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: complies with vehicle design standards;

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: complies with this Ordinance and any conditions subject to which a vehicle licence was issued in respect of the vehicle. (Amended 7 of 1992 s. 2)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be given in writing in respect of a particular vehicle and served either personally or by registered post on the owner, the registered owner or the new owner of any such vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be given by publication in the Gazette and in 1 Chinese and 1 English newspaper circulating in Hong Kong in respect of a vehicle of any class and by reference to model, country of origin, date of manufacture or any other thing;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a notice given under paragraph (a), specify the date and time that the vehicle is to be produced for examination;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a notice given under paragraph (b), include such advice and information as appears to the Commissioner to be required to enable the examination of a vehicle at a date and time to be specified by the Commissioner or by any person authorized to operate a place as a vehicle examination centre under section 88(3). (Added 7 of 1992 s. 2)

subsection.content: A vehicle produced at a vehicle examination centre pursuant to subsection (1) may be detained for a period not exceeding 24 hours.

subsection.leadIn: The fee for a vehicle examination under this section shall be payable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a notice given under subsection (1A)(a), upon receipt of the notice requiring the vehicle to be produced for examination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a notice given under subsection (1A)(b), upon the specifying of a date and time for the examination of the vehicle under subsection (1A)(d). (Replaced 7 of 1992 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Where a vehicle is to be examined at a vehicle examination centre not being the subject of an agreement made under section 88(3), the fee for such examination shall be payable to the Government and in the event of non-production of the vehicle at a date and time specified under subsection (1A)(c) or (d), no refund shall be payable of any fee paid unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner receives at least 14 days notice in writing of such non-production; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Commissioner is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: circumstances beyond the control of the person who was required to produce the vehicle prevented him from producing it; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: notice was given to the Commissioner of such non-production as soon as practicable. (Replaced 7 of 1992 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Where a vehicle is to be examined at a vehicle examination centre being the subject of an agreement made under section 88(3), the fee for such examination shall be payable to the person authorized under the agreement to operate the vehicle examination centre and in the event of non-production of the vehicle at a date and time specified under subsection (1A)(c) or (d), no refund shall be payable of any fee paid unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person so authorized receives at least 14 days notice in writing of such non-production; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Commissioner is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: circumstances beyond the control of the person who was required to produce the vehicle prevented him from producing it; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: notice was given to the person so authorized of such non-production as soon as practicable. (Added 7 of 1992 s. 2)

section.name: s79
section.heading: Examination orders for examination of vehicles
section.leadIn: The Commissioner or any police officer may serve or cause to be served personally on the driver, or by registered post on the registered owner, of a vehicle an examination order in a form specified by the Commissioner requiring production of the vehicle for examination at such vehicle examination centre, and at such time on such date, as shall be specified in the examination order, for the purpose of ascertaining whether the vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: accords with the particulars thereof contained in the register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is roadworthy;

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: complies with vehicle emission standards; (Added 3 of 1991 s. 7)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: complies with this Ordinance and any conditions subject to which a vehicle licence was issued in respect of the vehicle.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Examination of vehicle on road by police officer and removal to vehicle examination centre or police station

subsection.leadIn: A police officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: examine; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cause to be examined by a vehicle examiner,

subsection.continued: a vehicle which is being used on a road, for the purpose of ascertaining whether the vehicle complies with this Ordinance and any condition subject to which the vehicle licence in respect of the vehicle was issued.

subsection.leadIn: Any police officer who, as a result of an examination of a vehicle under subsection (1), has reason to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vehicle has been involved in an accident;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the vehicle is not roadworthy; (Amended 3 of 1991 s. 8)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: the vehicle does not comply with vehicle emission standards; or (Added 3 of 1991 s. 8)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the vehicle does not comply with this Ordinance or any condition subject to which the vehicle licence in respect of the vehicle was issued,

subsection.continued: may—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: direct the driver of the vehicle to drive it to such vehicle examination centre or police station as the police officer may specify; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: direct the driver and any other person to leave the vehicle and himself drive or remove the vehicle or cause it to be driven or removed to any vehicle examination centre or police station,

subsection.continued: and may cause the vehicle to be detained at a vehicle examination centre or police station for not more than 72 hours while the vehicle is examined by a vehicle examiner.

subsection.leadIn: A police officer who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: directs a driver to drive a vehicle; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: drives or removes a vehicle or cause it to be driven or removed,

subsection.continued: to a vehicle examination centre or police station under subsection (2) shall serve on the driver of the vehicle a notice specifying—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: his belief that the vehicle has been involved in an accident;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the respect in which he believes the vehicle is not roadworthy; (Amended 3 of 1991 s. 8)

paragraph.name: iia
paragraph.content: the respect in which he believes the vehicle does not comply with vehicle emission standards; or (Added 3 of 1991 s. 8)

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: the respect in which he believes the vehicle does not comply with this Ordinance or any condition subject to which the vehicle licence in respect of the vehicle was issued.

subsection.content: Any person who fails to comply with the directions of a police officer under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

Nothing in this section shall be deemed to authorize any person who is not the holder of a valid driving licence for a vehicle of the appropriate class to drive any vehicle in the course of any removal or examination.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Powers of vehicle examiner on examination of vehicle
section.content: In carrying out an examination of a vehicle for the purposes of any of the provisions of this Part a vehicle examiner may carry out or cause to be carried out such inspection, examination or test of the vehicle, any part of the vehicle, any accessory affixed to the vehicle or any equipment or part of the equipment of the vehicle as he thinks fit and may weigh the vehicle or any load on the vehicle.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Vehicle not in accordance with particulars in register, form of application for registration or notice of transfer

subsection.leadIn: Where on examination of a vehicle under this Part a vehicle examiner finds that a vehicle does not accord with the particulars of the vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: entered in the register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contained in an application for registration or notice of transfer of ownership,

subsection.continued: the vehicle examiner shall notify the Commissioner and shall serve notice personally or by registered post—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on the owner of the vehicle or on the person who produced the vehicle for examination if he is present during the examination; and (Amended 7 of 1992 s. 3)

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: where appropriate, on the new owner.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in a form specified by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: specify the manner in which the vehicle does not accord with the particulars of the vehicle—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: entered in the register; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: contained in the application for registration or notice of transfer of ownership.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Vehicle not roadworthy or not in accordance with the Ordinance or conditions of vehicle licence, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where on the examination of a vehicle under this Part it appears to the vehicle examiner that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vehicle is not roadworthy; (Amended 3 of 1991 s. 9)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: the vehicle does not comply with vehicle emission standards; (Added 3 of 1991 s. 9)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: the vehicle identification number of the vehicles has been altered or tampered with; or (Added 89 of 1994 s. 22)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the vehicle does not comply with this Ordinance or any conditions subject to which a vehicle licence was issued in respect of the vehicle,

subsection.continued: he shall—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: if he considers that the use of the vehicle on a road would be dangerous to other road users, or that the vehicle identification number has been altered or tampered with, refer the vehicle to a specially authorized vehicle examiner;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: in any other case, make a vehicle repair order.

subsection.content: Where a specially authorized vehicle examiner considers that the use on a road of a vehicle examined under this Part would be dangerous to other road users, or that the vehicle identification number of the vehicle has been altered or tampered with, he shall make a suspension of vehicle licence order and cause the vehicle licence to be removed from the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: A suspension of vehicle licence order shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in a form specified by the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except where the order is made because of altering or tampering with the vehicle identification number, require the registered owner of the vehicle to cause to be carried out the repairs or other work specified in the order;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the conditions on which the vehicle may be moved or driven on a road and in particular specify the manner in which the vehicle may be moved from and to the vehicle examination centre; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: be served personally or by registered post—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on the registered owner of the vehicle; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on the person who produced the vehicle for examination if he is present during the examination. (Replaced 7 of 1992 s. 4)

subsection.content: Except where the suspension of vehicle licence order is made because of altering or tampering with the vehicle identification number, a suspension of vehicle licence order shall continue in force in respect of a vehicle until the repairs or other work required thereby have been carried out satisfactorily.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: Where a suspension of vehicle licence order is made because of altering or tampering with a vehicle identification number, the order shall continue in force until the vehicle identification number of the vehicle to which the order relates has been verified to the satisfaction of the Commissioner as being the same as that contained in the relevant particulars in the register. (Added 89 of 1994 s. 23)

Where a suspension of vehicle licence order is in force in respect of a vehicle, the registered owner may produce the vehicle at such vehicle examination centre and at such time and on such date as may be specified by the Commissioner for examination by a vehicle examiner to ascertain whether the repairs or other work required by the order have been carried out satisfactorily, or the altering or tampering of the vehicle identification number has been verified in accordance with subsection (2A), as the case may be, and if such repairs or other work are found to have been so carried out, or the vehicle identification number has been so verified a specially authorized vehicle examiner shall cancel the suspension of vehicle licence order forthwith and restore the vehicle licence to the registered owner.

Where a suspension of vehicle licence order is in force in respect of a vehicle, any person who moves or drives that vehicle on a road except in accordance with the suspension of vehicle licence order commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended 7 of 1992 s. 4; E.R. 2 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: A vehicle repair order shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in a form specified by the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: require the registered owner of the vehicle to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: cause to be carried out the repairs or other work specified in the order; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: produce the vehicle at such vehicle examination centre, and at such time on such date or within such period, as shall be specified in the order; and (Amended 7 of 1992 s. 5)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: be served personally or by registered post—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on the registered owner of the vehicle; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on the person who produced the vehicle for examination if he is present during the examination. (Replaced 7 of 1992 s. 5)

subsection.content: If, on the examination of a vehicle produced at a vehicle examination centre in accordance with a vehicle repair order, the vehicle examiner is not satisfied that the repairs or other work required by the order have been carried out satisfactorily, he may make a further vehicle repair order under section 83.

The registered owner of a vehicle in respect of which a vehicle repair order has been made who fails to produce the vehicle for examination at the vehicle examination centre specified in the order at the time and on the date specified in the order, or on such further date and at the time as the Commissioner may allow in any case, commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings for an offence under subsection (3) it shall be a good defence for the registered owner to prove that at the date specified in the vehicle repair order for production of the vehicle for examination—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vehicle had been broken up, destroyed or sent permanently out of Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration document relating to the vehicle had been submitted to the Commissioner for cancellation of the registration.

subsection.content: A fee as specified in Schedule 3 shall be payable in respect of an examination under section 78, 84(3) or 85(2).
The Chief Executive in Council may by order published in the Gazette amend Schedule 3. (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)

subsection.leadIn: If a vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produced at a vehicle examination centre pursuant to a requirement under section 78 or 79 or of a vehicle repair order or pursuant to section 84(3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: driven to a vehicle examination centre under section 80,

subsection.continued: is not claimed within 14 days, the Commissioner shall serve personally or by registered post on the owner, the registered owner or the new owner, as the case may be, a notice in writing informing him that unless he—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: pays to the Commissioner any fee due under section 86; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: removes the vehicle from the vehicle examination centre within 7 days of the service of the notice,

subsection.continued: the vehicle shall be forfeited to the Government and may be sold or otherwise disposed of in such manner as the Commissioner thinks fit.

subsection.content: If a notice under subsection (1) is not complied with the vehicle shall thereupon be forfeited to the Government and may be sold or otherwise disposed of as the Commissioner thinks fit.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Vehicle examiners and vehicle examination centre

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall appoint vehicle examiners; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may authorize in writing any vehicle examiner to issue suspension of vehicle licence orders,

subsection.continued: for the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, in writing, designate any place as a vehicle examination centre and may impose such conditions relating to that designation and to the operation of that vehicle examination centre as he thinks fit. (Replaced 7 of 1992 s. 6)

Where a place is designated as a vehicle examination centre under subsection (2) the Commissioner may by agreement in writing with any person authorize that person to operate that place as a vehicle examination centre subject to such terms and conditions as the Commissioner may specify in the agreement. (Added 7 of 1992 s. 6)

Without affecting the generality of subsection (3), an agreement in writing under that subsection may include a condition that the Commissioner may suspend or revoke the authorization of any person to operate a place as a vehicle examination centre. (Added 7 of 1992 s. 6)

The Commissioner may, if he considers the public interest so requires, give directions of a general character in writing to any person authorized under subsection (3) in relation to the operation of a place as a vehicle examination centre and that person shall comply with those directions. (Added 7 of 1992 s. 6)

A certificate in writing purporting to be under the hand of the Commissioner setting forth the amount of any money due or payable to the Government by the person authorized under subsection (3) under the agreement shall be prima facie evidence of the facts certified therein. Without prejudice to any other remedy of the Government for the recovery of such money under the agreement, the same may be recovered as a debt due to the Government. (Added 7 of 1992 s. 6. Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)

No proceedings in tort shall lie against the Government or any public officer by reason only of the fact that a place is designated as a vehicle examination centre under subsection (2). (Added 7 of 1992 s. 6. Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)

part.name: P9A
part.heading: Examination of Private Cars and Light Goods Vehicles at Car Testing Centres

section.name: s88A
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part and Schedule 8, unless the context otherwise requires— (Amended 3 of 1991 s. 11)
section.def: approved car tester (認可車輛測試員) means a person authorized in writing by the Commissioner under section 88F(1)(d);
car testing centre (車輛測試中心) means a place designated as a car testing centre under section 88C(1);

certificate of roadworthiness (車輛宜於道路上使用證明書) means a certificate issued by a car testing centre in the form specified by the Commissioner in respect of a private car or light goods vehicle and indicating that the private car or light goods vehicle was found to be roadworthy upon examination at the car testing centre; (Amended 36 of 1990 s. 4)
code of practice (實務守則) means a code of practice issued and from time to time revised under section 88F(1)(a);
designation (指定) means a designation of a car testing centre under section 88C(1);
proprietor (東主), in relation to a car testing centre, means a person having the conduct or control of it, whether or not he is a natural person and whether or not he is the owner;
responsible person (負責人) means a person authorized in writing by the Commissioner under section 88F(1)(e).

section.name: s88B
section.heading: Examination of private cars before licensing

subsection.content: Before licensing a private car or a light goods vehicle, the Commissioner may, for the purpose of ascertaining whether the private car or the light goods vehicle is roadworthy, require the registered owner to have the private car or the light goods vehicle examined at a car testing centre.

Subsection (1) applies to any private car manufactured not less than 6 years before the date with effect from which the private car is to be licensed, and to any light goods vehicle manufactured not less than 1 year before the date with effect from which the light goods vehicle is to be licensed. (Amended L.N. 266 of 1992; L.N. 163 of 1993)

The Secretary may by order published in the Gazette amend subsection (2) by substituting for the period or periods of years specified therein another period or periods and he may by such order make different provision for private cars and light goods vehicles. (Amended 90 of 1993 s. 6; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; 6 of 2012 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may exercise his powers under subsection (1) in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all private cars or light goods vehicles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any class or description of such cars or vehicles;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a particular private car or light goods vehicle. (Added 36 of 1990 s. 5)

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, in writing, designate any place (including any place designated under section 77C(1) as a vehicle emission testing centre) as a car testing centre and may impose such conditions relating to that designation as he thinks fit. (Amended 3 of 1991 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: Where a place is designated as a car testing centre under subsection (1), such designation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall authorize the person specified in the designation as the proprietor of that place, to operate that place as a car testing centre in accordance with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any code of practice for the time being in force issued, and from time to time revised, by the Commissioner under section 88F(1)(a);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: Schedule 8; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: such conditions as may be specified by the Commissioner in the designation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be valid except on payment of the fee specified in paragraph 6(a) of Schedule 8.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (2)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fees specified in paragraph 6(b) of Schedule 8 shall be payable by the registered owner of a private car or a light goods vehicle to the proprietor of a car testing centre in respect of an examination carried out under this Part; (Amended 36 of 1990 s. 6)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the conditions that may be specified in a designation under subsection (2)(a)(iii) may include conditions relating to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the supply by the Commissioner to the proprietor specified in the designation of any document or form to be used for the purposes of this Part; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the fees as specified in paragraph 6(c) of Schedule 8, payable by that proprietor in respect of such supply and the refund of such fees.

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall cause notice of the designation of a place as a car testing centre to be published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 88D, a designation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be valid for a period of 3 years from such date as shall be specified in the designation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, on application made to the Commissioner not less than 6 months before the date of its expiration and on payment of the fee specified in paragraph 6(a) of Schedule 8, be renewed in writing by the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: A renewal of a designation under subsection (5) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not be valid except on payment of the fee specified in paragraph 6(a) of Schedule 8; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be valid for a period of 3 years from such date as the Commissioner shall specify in the renewal.

subsection.leadIn: If in the case of any proprietor of a car testing centre it appears to the Commissioner that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: there has been a breach of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the code of practice;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: Schedule 8;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the conditions specified in the designation under section 88C; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certificates of roadworthiness have been improperly issued; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: certificates of roadworthiness have been incorrectly dated for fraudulent purposes; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the proprietor has ceased to trade, or is being wound up or grounds exist for a creditor to present a bankruptcy petition against him, (Amended 37 of 1998 s. 6)

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may serve on the proprietor a notice stating his intention to revoke the designation and the ground or grounds therefor and requiring the proprietor to show cause in writing, within 28 days after the service of such notice, why the designation should not be so revoked.

subsection.leadIn: Where after a notice is served on a proprietor under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proprietor does not show cause why the designation should not be revoked; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner, having considered any representations made by the proprietor, is of the opinion that the proprietor has not shown good cause why the designation should not be revoked,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may, by notice in writing served on the proprietor, revoke the designation with effect from such date being not less than 14 days after service of the notice as he shall specify in the notice.

subsection.content: Any proprietor of a car testing centre aggrieved by a decision of the Commissioner under subsection (2) to revoke the designation of such car testing centre may appeal to a Transport Tribunal against such decision within 14 days of receiving notice of the decision and on any such appeal a Transport Tribunal may affirm, amend or reverse such decision.
A decision of the Commissioner appealed against under subsection (3) shall not have effect pending the determination of the appeal by a Transport Tribunal.
The Commissioner shall cause notice of the revocation of a designation under subsection (2) to be published in the Gazette as soon as practicable after the revocation has come into effect.
No compensation shall be payable in respect of the revocation of a designation under this section.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding section 88D, a designation in respect of a car testing centre shall be terminated in the following cases—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the Commissioner serves written notice on the proprietor of not less than 6 months, on the expiration of the period of such notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the proprietor serves written notice on the Commissioner of not less than 3 months, on the expiration of the period of such notice.

subsection.content: Where a designation is terminated under this section, the Commissioner may make a refund in respect of any fee paid under section 88C of an amount not exceeding the sum obtained by dividing the amount of the fee paid by 36 and multiplying the result by the number of months in the unexpired period of the designation.
The Commissioner shall cause a copy of every notice served under subsection (1) to be published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part the Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue and from time to time revise a code of practice setting out the practice and procedure to be followed and specifying the equipment to be used for the examination of private cars and light goods vehicles at car testing centres;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify any form or other document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: conduct training courses for the purposes of paragraph (d);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: authorize in writing persons to act as approved car testers who have attended and completed a training course conducted by the Commissioner for the purpose of training persons to be approved car testers;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: authorize in writing persons to act as responsible persons at car testing centres in respect of the supervision of examinations of private cars or light goods vehicles carried out under this Part.

subsection.content: A code of practice issued, and from time to time revised, under subsection (1) may specify the circumstances in which the fees set out in paragraph 6(b) of Schedule 8 (as being fees payable to the proprietor of a car testing centre by the registered owner of a private car or a light goods vehicle in respect of an examination carried out under this Part) are to be waived, reduced or refunded.

section.name: s88G
section.heading: Power to enter and inspect records, equipment, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Any public officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for the purposes of this section, may, during the hours when a car testing centre is open for business, enter any car testing centre and on production of his authorization—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect and take copies of any record, book or document kept or maintained in respect of the examination of private cars and light goods vehicles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inspect or test any equipment used for the examination of private cars and light goods vehicles; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: observe and monitor the examination of any private car or light goods vehicle. (Amended 36 of 1990 s. 8)

subsection.content: Any person who obstructs an officer in the execution of his duty under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)
The Chief Executive may by order published in the Gazette amend Schedule 8. (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)
The Financial Secretary may by order published in the Gazette amend the fees set out in paragraph 6 of Schedule 8.

section.name: s88I
section.heading: Protection of Government and public officers
section.content: No proceedings in tort shall lie against the Government or any public officer by reason only of the fact that a place is designated as a car testing centre under this Part.

section.name: s88J
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: course certificate (課程證書) means a certificate in a form specified by the Commissioner indicating that a person has completed a driving instruction course at a driving school;
proprietor (東主), in relation to a driving school, means a person having the conduct or control of it, whether or not he is the owner.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, in writing, designate any place as a driving school and may impose such conditions relating to that designation as he thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: Where a place is designated as a driving school under subsection (1), such designation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall authorize the person specified in the designation as the proprietor of that place, to operate that place as a driving school in accordance with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: Schedule 9; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such conditions as may be specified by the Commissioner in the designation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be valid except on payment of the fee specified in Schedule 9.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (2)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fees charged by the proprietor of a driving school for a driving instruction course and the issue of a course certificate or a duplicate copy of a course certificate in respect of motor cycles or motor tricycles shall be subject to the approval of the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions that may be specified in a designation under subsection (2)(a)(ii) may include conditions relating to the issue of a course certificate or duplicate copy of a course certificate in respect of motor cycles or motor tricycles.

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall cause notice of a designation under subsection (1) to be published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 88L, a designation under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be valid for a maximum period of 5 years from such date as shall be specified in the designation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, on application made to the Commissioner not less than 3 months before the date of its expiration and on payment of the fee specified in Schedule 9, be renewed in writing by the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: A renewal of a designation under subsection (5) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be valid for a maximum period of 5 years from such date as the Commissioner shall specify; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not be valid except on payment of the fee specified in Schedule 9.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, if he considers that it would be in the public interest to do so, exempt any person from the payment of the fee specified in Schedule 9.

subsection.leadIn: If in the case of any proprietor of a driving school it appears to the Commissioner that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: there has been a breach of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: Schedule 9; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the conditions specified in the designation under section 88K; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any course certificate has been improperly issued; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the particulars on any course certificate have been incorrectly stated for fraudulent purposes; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the proprietor has ceased to trade, or is being wound up or grounds exist for a creditor to present a bankruptcy petition against him, (Amended 37 of 1998 s. 6)

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may serve on the proprietor a notice stating his intention to revoke the designation and the ground or grounds therefor and requiring the proprietor to show cause in writing, within 28 days after the service of such notice, why the designation should not be so revoked.

subsection.leadIn: Where after a notice is served on a proprietor of a driving school under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proprietor does not show cause why the designation should not be revoked; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner, having considered any representations made by the proprietor, is of the opinion that the proprietor has not shown good cause why the designation should not be revoked,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may, by notice in writing served on the proprietor, revoke the designation with effect from such date being not less than 14 days after service of the notice as he shall specify in the notice.

subsection.content: Any proprietor of a driving school aggrieved by a decision of the Commissioner under subsection (2) may appeal to a Transport Tribunal against such decision within 14 days of receiving notice of the decision and on any such appeal a Transport Tribunal may affirm, amend or reverse such decision.
A decision of the Commissioner appealed against under subsection (3) shall not have effect pending the determination of the appeal by a Transport Tribunal.
The Commissioner shall cause notice of the revocation of a designation under subsection (2) to be published in the Gazette as soon as practicable after the revocation has come into effect.
No compensation shall be payable in respect of the revocation of a designation under this section.
Where a designation is revoked under this section, any fee paid under section 88K(2) or (6) shall not be refunded.

Within 28 days after a revocation under this section has come into effect, the driving school shall make a refund of the fee paid by a person taking a driving instruction course to that person, and the amount to be refunded shall be an amount obtained by dividing the fee paid by the total number of prescribed parts of a course and multiplying the result by the number of prescribed parts of a course which has not been given.
A revocation under this section shall not affect the validity of course certificates properly issued.

Notwithstanding section 88L, a designation in respect of a driving school shall, if the proprietor serves written notice of termination on the Commissioner of not less than 3 months, be terminated on the expiration of the period of such notice.

Where a designation is terminated under this section, the Commissioner may make a refund in respect of any fee paid under section 88K of an amount not exceeding the sum obtained by dividing the amount of the fee paid by the number of complete months of the designation and multiplying the result by the number of complete months in the unexpired period of the designation.

Within 28 days after a designation is terminated under this section, the driving school shall make a refund of the fee paid by a person taking a driving instruction course to that person, and the amount to be refunded shall be an amount obtained by dividing the fee paid by the total number of prescribed parts of a course and multiplying the result by the number of prescribed parts of a course which has not been given.
The termination of a designation under this section shall not affect the validity of course certificates properly issued.

section.name: s88N
section.heading: Ancillary powers of the Commissioner
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may issue, and may from time to time revise, a code of practice setting out the requirements, procedure and standards in respect of the content and duration of driving instruction courses, the facilities to be provided, the safety measures to be adopted and the equipment to be used in a driving school and any other matter he thinks fit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may specify any form, including the form of any course certificate or other document; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may authorize in writing responsible persons to sign course certificates.

subsection.leadIn: Any public officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for the purposes of this section, may, during the hours when a driving school is open for business, enter the driving school and on production of his authorization—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: observe and monitor the giving of driving instruction courses;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: inspect the driving school and ascertain whether there has been a breach of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: Schedule 9; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the conditions specified in the designation under section 88K; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: inspect or test any motor vehicle or equipment used for the giving of driving instruction courses.

subsection.leadIn: If it is made to appear to a magistrate by information upon oath that there is reason to believe that there has been a breach of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Schedule 9; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions specified in the designation under section 88K,

subsection.continued: the magistrate may issue a warrant authorizing any public officer to enter and search any driving school.

subsection.content: A public officer who entered a driving school in pursuance of a warrant issued under subsection (2) may inspect and make copies of any record, book or document kept or maintained in respect of the giving of driving instruction courses.

section.name: s88P
section.heading: Amendment of Schedule 9
section.content: The Chief Executive may by order published in the Gazette amend Schedule 9.

section.name: s88Q
section.heading: Protection of Government and public officers
section.content: No proceedings in tort shall lie against the Government or any public officer by reason only of the fact that a place is designated as a driving school under this Part.

part.name: P10
part.heading: Suspension of Licences of Motor Vehicles

section.name: s89
section.heading: Interpretation in this Part
section.content: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires, fixed penalty (定額罰款) means, in relation to an offence specified in Schedule 4, the fixed penalty specified for that offence in the Schedule to the Fixed Penalty (Criminal Proceedings) Ordinance (Cap. 240).

section.name: s90
section.heading: Notice of intention to suspend on the conviction of a driver

subsection.content: Where a person has been convicted of an offence specified in Schedule 4, or the fixed penalty for such an offence has been paid, the Commissioner shall, within 14 days after the date of the conviction or payment of the fixed penalty, cause a notice to be served on the registered owner of the motor vehicle in respect of which the offence was committed. (Amended L.N. 95 of 1993)

subsection.leadIn: A notice served under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: specify—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the offence of which the person was convicted or for which the fixed penalty has been paid and the date of conviction or payment of the fixed penalty;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date on which the offence took place;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the time when and place where the offence occurred;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the registration mark of the motor vehicle; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the name of the person who committed the offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify the registered owner that the Commissioner may under section 93 suspend the vehicle licence for the period specified in column 3 or 4 of Schedule 4; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: notify the registered owner that he may, within 14 days after the date of service of the notice—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: make representations in writing to the Commissioner showing cause why the vehicle licence should not be suspended; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: apply in writing to the Commissioner for a hearing before a Transport Tribunal to show cause why the vehicle licence should not be suspended.

subsection.content: In the event of an appeal against conviction, the notice served under subsection (1) shall be of no effect, and, if the appeal is abandoned or the conviction is not quashed on the appeal, a further notice in accordance with this section shall be served on the registered owner of the motor vehicle within 14 days after the appeal was abandoned or finally determined.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Hearing to show cause why vehicle licence should not be suspended

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after he receives an application from the registered owner of a motor vehicle for a hearing before a Transport Tribunal, the Commissioner shall cause a notice to be served on the owner specifying the place where, time when and date on which he may appear before a Transport Tribunal to show cause why the vehicle licence should not be suspended.

The Commissioner shall, so far as practicable, ensure that the date of the hearing before the Transport Tribunal is not less than 10 days nor more than 30 days after the date of the notice served on the registered owner under subsection (1).

A Transport Tribunal may postpone a hearing if it thinks fit and where a hearing is postponed, the Commissioner shall cause a notice to be served on the registered owner specifying the date to which the hearing has been postponed.

If the registered owner of a motor vehicle does not appear before the Transport Tribunal on the date of the hearing notified to him in a notice under subsection (1) or (3), his application for a hearing shall be deemed to have been withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: A Transport Tribunal shall after considering—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any evidence received by it, whether tendered on behalf of the registered owner of the motor vehicle or otherwise, which it considers relevant to the hearing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any representations made by or on behalf of the registered owner of the motor vehicle, whether orally or in writing;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any representations made by or on behalf of the Commissioner, whether orally or in writing,

subsection.continued: determine whether or not the registered owner has shown cause why the vehicle licence should not be suspended.

subsection.content: The decision of the Transport Tribunal under subsection (1) shall be final.
If the Transport Tribunal decides that the registered owner has shown cause why the vehicle licence should not be suspended the Commissioner shall notify the registered owner accordingly.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Suspension of vehicle licence and delivery of vehicle into custody of Commissioner

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no written representations are made by or on behalf of the registered owner of a motor vehicle, and no application is made for a hearing before a Transport Tribunal, within the time notified in a notice served under section 90(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application for a hearing before a Transport Tribunal is deemed to have been withdrawn under section 91(4),

subsection.continued: the Commissioner shall suspend the vehicle licence for the appropriate period specified in column 3 or 4 of Schedule 4.

subsection.content: If a Transport Tribunal decides that the registered owner of a motor vehicle has not shown cause why the vehicle licence should not be suspended the Commissioner shall suspend it for the appropriate period specified in column 3 or 4 of Schedule 4.
Where the Commissioner suspends a vehicle licence under subsection (1) or (2), he shall cause a notice to be served on the registered owner.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (3) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: specify—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the registration mark of the motor vehicle the licence of which is suspended; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the period during which the vehicle licence shall be suspended and the date of commencement of the suspension; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: direct the registered owner to deliver the motor vehicle into the custody of the Commissioner on the day and at the time and place specified in the notice.

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall keep a record of every suspension of a vehicle licence under subsection (1) or (2) in such form as he thinks fit.

section.name: s94
section.heading: Penalty payable if vehicle not delivered into custody

subsection.content: If without reasonable excuse, a motor vehicle is not delivered into the custody of the Commissioner in accordance with a notice served under section 93, the registered owner shall be liable to pay to the Government a penalty of $200 for each day or part thereof while the suspension of the vehicle licence continues in force and the motor vehicle is not in the custody of the Commissioner or the Commissioner of Police under section 95.
Any penalty due under subsection (1) may be recovered from the registered owner by civil proceedings as a debt due to the Government. (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)

If a motor vehicle has not been delivered into the custody of the Commissioner at the expiration of 7 days after the date specified in a notice served under section 93, any police officer may seize the motor vehicle.

Subject to subsection (3), a police officer who has seized a motor vehicle under subsection (1) shall deliver it forthwith into the custody of the Commissioner at the place specified in the notice under section 93.

If at the time when a motor vehicle is seized it is not practicable for a police officer to deliver it directly to the place specified in the notice under section 93, he may take the motor vehicle to a police station, and thereafter a police officer shall deliver it to the place so specified as soon as practicable and in any event not later than 7 days after the seizure.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of seizing a motor vehicle under this section, a police officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: order any person who is in or on the motor vehicle to alight from it;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: order any person who appears to him to be in possession of any keys to the motor vehicle to give them to him or to any other person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: enter and search any premises or place if he knows or has reason to suspect that the motor vehicle is in or on such premises or place.

subsection.content: A police officer may use such force as is reasonably necessary for the purpose of entering or searching any premises or place under subsection (4)(c) or of seizing or removing any motor vehicle from such premises or place under this section.

subsection.leadIn: If a motor vehicle is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: delivered into the custody of the Commissioner in accordance with a notice served under section 93; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: seized and delivered into his custody under section 95,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner shall, within 10 days of its delivery into his custody, serve on the registered owner a notice in writing in accordance with subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: specify—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date of delivery into the custody of the Commissioner; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the place at which the motor vehicle is being held; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: notify the registered owner that at the expiry of the period of suspension the Commissioner will return the motor vehicle to the registered owner if, not later than 30 days after the expiry of the period of suspension, the registered owner—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: claims the motor vehicle; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: pays to the Commissioner any penalty payable under section 94 and, if the vehicle was seized by a police officer under section 95 the removal charge specified in Schedule 5; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: notify the registered owner of the effect of subsection (4).

subsection.content: If the registered owner claims the motor vehicle within 30 days after the expiry of the period of suspension of the licence, the Commissioner shall, on payment of any penalty payable under section 94 and, if the vehicle was seized by a police officer under section 95, of the removal charge specified in Schedule 5, return the motor vehicle to the registered owner.

If the registered owner does not make a claim for the return within 30 days after the expiry of the period of suspension, the motor vehicle shall thereupon be forfeited to the Government and may be sold or otherwise disposed of in such manner as the Commissioner thinks fit. (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)

section.name: s97
section.heading: Record and certificate of alleged offences

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall keep a record of the registration mark of every motor vehicle in connection with which any person is alleged to have committed an offence specified in Schedule 4.

The Commissioner shall, on application made to him in such manner as he may determine, issue a certificate stating whether or not at the time of the issue of the certificate any person is, according to the record maintained under subsection (1), alleged to have committed an offence specified in Schedule 4 in connection with the motor vehicle bearing the registration mark specified in the application.
A certificate issued under subsection (2) shall be valid for 72 hours from the time of issue.

section.name: s98
section.heading: Commissioner of Police to supply information for the record
section.content: For the purposes of section 97 the Commissioner of Police shall notify the Commissioner of every alleged offence specified in Schedule 4.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Removal of registration mark from the record
section.leadIn: Where a person who is alleged to have committed an offence specified in Schedule 4 in connection with a motor vehicle the registration mark of which has been recorded under section 97—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not prosecuted for that offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is found not guilty of that offence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has his conviction for that offence quashed on appeal,

section.continued: the Commissioner shall forthwith remove from the record the registration mark of the motor vehicle concerned.

subsection.content: Sections 90 to 96 shall not apply or shall cease to apply where a motor vehicle is sold or otherwise disposed of and the new registered owner is, at the time of delivery of notice of transfer of ownership in accordance with the regulations, in possession of a valid certificate issued by the Commissioner under section 97 to the effect that at the time of issue, no person was alleged to have committed an offence specified in the Schedule 4 in respect of that motor vehicle.

Subject to subsection (1), sections 90 to 96 shall apply notwithstanding that a transfer of the ownership of a motor vehicle has been registered by the Commissioner after a person has committed an offence specified in Schedule 4 in connection with that vehicle.

section.name: s101
section.heading: Service of notices
section.content: Any notice required under this Part to be served on the registered owner of a motor vehicle may be served on him in person or by forwarding it by registered post or recorded mail to him at the address shown in the register of motor vehicles maintained by the Commissioner under this Ordinance.

section.name: s102
section.heading: Amendment of Schedule 4
section.content: The Chief Executive in Council may by order published in the Gazette amend Schedule 4.

part.name: P10A
part.heading: Driving Improvement Schools and Taxi Service Improvement Schools

section.name: s102A
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part and Schedule 12, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: AttendanceCertificate
def.leadIn: attendance certificate (修習證書)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: includes, except for the purposes of section 102B(3)(b)(i) or 102E(d)(i), a duplicate of the certificate; (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 51)

section.def: code of practice (實務守則) means a code of practice issued under section 102E(a) as it is in force from time to time;

def.name: CourseCertificate
def.leadIn: course certificate (課程證書)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: includes, except for the purposes of section 102B(3)(b)(ii) or 102E(d)(i), a duplicate of the certificate; (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 51)

section.def: designation (指定) means a designation made under section 102B(1);

proprietor (東主), in relation to a driving improvement school or taxi service improvement school, means a person having the conduct or control of it, whether or not the person is its owner; (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 51)

taxi course attendance certificate (的士課程修習證書)—(a)means a certificate issued under section 102B(3A)(b)(i) or 102E(d)(ii); and(b)includes, except for the purposes of section 102B(3A)(b)(i) or 102E(d)(ii), a duplicate of the certificate; (Added 35 of 2023 s. 51)

taxi course completion certificate (的士課程完課證書)—(a)means a certificate issued under section 102B(3A)(b)(ii) or 102E(d)(ii); and(b)includes, except for the purposes of section 102B(3A)(b)(ii) or 102E(d)(ii), a duplicate of the certificate. (Added 35 of 2023 s. 51)

section.name: s102B
section.heading: Commissioner may designate driving improvement schools and taxi service improvement schools

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, in writing, designate any place as a driving improvement school, or as a taxi service improvement school, and may impose any conditions relating to the designation as the Commissioner considers appropriate. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 52)

subsection.leadIn: Where a place is designated as a driving improvement school, or as a taxi service improvement school, under subsection (1), such designation— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 52)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: authorizes the person specified in the designation as the proprietor to operate that place as a driving improvement school, or as a taxi service improvement school, in compliance with— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 52)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a relevant code of practice; (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 52)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for a driving improvement school—in subsection (3); or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for a taxi service improvement school—in subsection (3A); and (Replaced 35 of 2023 s. 52)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: such conditions as may be specified by the Commissioner in the designation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be valid except on payment of the fee determined under Schedule 12.

subsection.leadIn: The condition referred to in subsection (2)(a)(iii) for a driving improvement school is that the proprietor of the school must ensure that— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 52)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: driving improvement courses are provided by the school in accordance with the relevant code of practice— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 52)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: to a holder of a driving licence other than—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a learner’s driving licence;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a temporary driving licence; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a driving licence to drive Government vehicles;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to a person who is ordered under section 72A(1)(b), (1A) or (9A), or is required under section 8AA(1) of or ordered under section 8AA(6) of the Road Traffic (Driving-offence Points) Ordinance (Cap. 375), to attend and complete a driving improvement course; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to a person who is disqualified until he has attended and completed a driving improvement course at his own cost; and (Replaced 23 of 2008 s. 21)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where a person attends and completes a driving improvement course at the school—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: a course certificate in a form specified by the Commissioner is issued by the school, on the Commissioner’s direction, to the person, indicating that the person has attended and completed the course in accordance with the relevant code of practice. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 52)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: The condition referred to in subsection (2)(a)(iii) for a taxi service improvement school is that the proprietor of the school must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: taxi service improvement courses are provided by the school in accordance with the relevant code of practice—

subparagraph.content: to a holder of a driving licence to drive a taxi;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is ordered under section 72A(1)(b) or (9A); or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is required under section 20, or ordered under section 23(2), of the Taxi-Driver-Offence Points Ordinance (Cap. 647), (Amended E.R. 5 of 2024)

subparagraph.continued: to attend and complete a taxi service improvement course; and

subparagraph.content: to a person who is disqualified from driving a taxi until the person has attended and completed a taxi service improvement course at the person’s own cost; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if a person attends and completes a taxi service improvement course at the school—

subparagraph.content: a taxi course attendance certificate in a form specified by the Commissioner is issued by the school to the person immediately after the attendance and completion, indicating that the person has attended and completed the course;

a taxi course completion certificate in a form specified by the Commissioner is issued by the school, on the Commissioner’s direction, to the person, indicating that the person has attended and completed the course in accordance with the relevant code of practice. (Added 35 of 2023 s. 52)

subsection.content: The Secretary may by notice published in the Gazette amend subsection (3)(a)(i)(A), (B) or (C). (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; 23 of 2008 s. 21; 6 of 2012 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (2)(a)— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 52)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Commissioner may from time to time determine the maximum fees that may be charged— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 52)

subparagraph.content: by the proprietor of a driving improvement school for a driving improvement course and the issue of an attendance certificate or course certificate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the fees charged— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 52)

subparagraph.content: by the proprietor of a driving improvement school for a driving improvement course and the issue of an attendance certificate or course certificate; or
by the proprietor of a taxi service improvement school for a taxi service improvement course and the issue of a taxi course attendance certificate or taxi course completion certificate,

paragraph.continued: must not exceed their respective maximum fees as determined under paragraph (a); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the conditions that may be specified in a designation under subsection (2)(a)(iv) may include conditions relating to the issue of an attendance certificate, course certificate, taxi course attendance certificate or taxi course completion certificate. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 52)

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner shall cause notice of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a designation that he has made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the maximum fees that he has determined under subsection (5)(a),

subsection.continued: to be published in the Gazette.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (6) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 102C and 102D, a designation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is valid for a maximum period of 3 years from the date specified in the designation; and (Replaced 35 of 2023 s. 52)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, on the application of the proprietor of the school made to the Commissioner at least 3 months before the date of its expiration, be renewed in writing by the Commissioner. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 52)

subsection.leadIn: Where a designation is renewed under subsection (8)(b), the renewed designation shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be valid for a maximum period of 3 years from such date as shall be specified in the renewed designation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not be valid except on payment of the fee determined under Schedule 12.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may waive in whole or in part the payment of a fee under subsection (2)(b) or (9)(b) if he considers that it is in the public interest to do so.

subsection.leadIn: A designation of a driving improvement school may, in accordance with this section, be revoked on any of the following grounds—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any proprietor of the school—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: Part 1 of Schedule 12;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a relevant code of practice;

subparagraph.name: C
