subparagraph.content: the condition referred to in section 102B(2)(a)(iii) for a driving improvement school; or

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: any of the conditions specified under section 102B(2)(a)(iv) in the designation of the school;
has issued any attendance certificate or course certificate improperly;
has entered any incorrect particulars on an attendance certificate or course certificate for fraudulent purposes; or
has ceased to have the conduct or control of the school, or is being wound up;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: grounds exist for a creditor to present a bankruptcy petition against any proprietor of the school. (Replaced 35 of 2023 s. 53)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: A designation of a taxi service improvement school may, in accordance with this section, be revoked on any of the following grounds—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any proprietor of the school—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: Part 2 of Schedule 12;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a relevant code of practice;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the condition referred to in section 102B(2)(a)(iii) for a taxi service improvement school; or

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: any of the conditions specified under section 102B(2)(a)(iv) in the designation of the school;
has issued any taxi course attendance certificate or taxi course completion certificate improperly;
has ceased to have the conduct or control of the school, or is being wound up;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: grounds exist for a creditor to present a bankruptcy petition against any proprietor of the school. (Added 35 of 2023 s. 53)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: If it appears to the Commissioner that a designation of a school may be revoked on any of the grounds referred to in subsections (1) and (1A), the Commissioner may serve on the proprietor a written notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating the Commissioner’s intention to revoke the designation and the ground or grounds for the revocation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stating that the proprietor may make representations in writing, within 28 days after the service of the notice, why the designation should not be so revoked. (Added 35 of 2023 s. 53)

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice has been served on the proprietor of a driving improvement school, or on the proprietor of a taxi service improvement school, under subsection (1B); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the proprietor does not make any representations in writing why the designation should not be revoked within the period specified in subsection (1B)(b); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Commissioner, having considered any such representations made by the proprietor, considers that the proprietor has not shown good cause why the designation should not be revoked,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may, by notice in writing served on the proprietor, revoke the designation with effect from such date being not less than 14 days after service of the notice as he shall specify in the notice. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 53)

subsection.content: The proprietor of a driving improvement school, or the proprietor of a taxi service improvement school, aggrieved by a decision of the Commissioner under subsection (2) may appeal to a Transport Tribunal against the decision within 14 days after receiving notice of the decision, and on any such appeal, a Transport Tribunal may affirm, amend or reverse the decision. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 53)
A decision of the Commissioner that is appealed against under subsection (3) shall not have effect pending the determination of the appeal.
The Commissioner shall cause notice of the revocation of a designation under subsection (2) to be published in the Gazette as soon as practicable after the revocation has come into effect.
A notice under subsection (5) is not subsidiary legislation.

No compensation is payable to the proprietor of a driving improvement school, or to the proprietor of a taxi service improvement school, in respect of the revocation of a designation under subsection (2) which relates to the school. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 53)
Where a designation is revoked under subsection (2), any fee paid under section 102B(2)(b) or (9)(b) shall not be refunded.

subsection.leadIn: Within 28 days after the revocation of a designation under subsection (2) has come into effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a revocation of designation as a driving improvement school—the last proprietor of the former driving improvement school to which the designation relates must refund a person the fee the person has paid for taking a driving improvement course at the school for any part of the course that has not been completed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a revocation of designation as a taxi service improvement school—the last proprietor of the former taxi service improvement school to which the designation relates must refund a person the fee the person has paid for taking a taxi service improvement course at the school for any part of the course that has not been completed. (Replaced 35 of 2023 s. 53)

subsection.name: 9A
subsection.content: The amount to be refunded under subsection (9) is the amount obtained by dividing the fee paid by the total number of parts of a course and multiplying the result by the number of parts of a course that has not been given. (Added 35 of 2023 s. 53)

subsection.leadIn: The revocation of a designation under subsection (2) does not affect— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 53)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a revocation of designation as a driving improvement school—the validity of attendance certificates or course certificates issued lawfully by the former driving improvement school to which the designation relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a revocation of designation as a taxi service improvement school—the validity of taxi course attendance certificates or taxi course completion certificates issued lawfully by the former taxi service improvement school to which the designation relates. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 53)

subsection.content: Despite section 102C, if the proprietor of a driving improvement school or a taxi service improvement school serves a written notice of termination of not less than 3 months on the Commissioner, the designation of the school terminates on the expiry of the period of the notice. (Replaced 35 of 2023 s. 54)

Upon the termination of a designation under subsection (1), the Commissioner may make a refund in respect of any fee paid under section 102B(2)(b) or (9)(b) of an amount not exceeding the amount obtained by dividing the amount of the fee paid by the number of complete months of the designation and multiplying the result by the number of complete months in the unexpired period of the designation.

subsection.leadIn: Within 28 days after a designation is terminated under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a termination of designation as a driving improvement school—the last proprietor of the former driving improvement school to which the designation relates must refund a person the fee the person has paid for taking a driving improvement course at the school for any part of the course that has not been completed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a termination of designation as a taxi service improvement school—the last proprietor of the former taxi service improvement school to which the designation relates must refund a person the fee the person has paid for taking a taxi service improvement course at the school for any part of the course that has not been completed. (Replaced 35 of 2023 s. 54)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: The amount to be refunded under subsection (3) is the amount obtained by dividing the fee paid by the total number of parts of a course and multiplying the result by the number of parts of a course that has not been given. (Added 35 of 2023 s. 54)

subsection.leadIn: The termination of a designation under subsection (1) does not affect— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 54)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a termination of designation as a driving improvement school—the validity of attendance certificates or course certificates issued lawfully by the former driving improvement school to which the designation relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a termination of designation as a taxi service improvement school—the validity of taxi course attendance certificates or taxi course completion certificates issued lawfully by the former taxi service improvement school to which the designation relates. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 54)

section.name: s102E
section.heading: Ancillary powers of Commissioner
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, the Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: issue, and from time to time revise, a code of practice setting out—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the requirements, procedures and standards in respect of the content and duration of driving improvement courses or taxi service improvement courses;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the requirements and procedures— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 55)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for providing information by a driving improvement school to the Commissioner in respect of a person’s completion of driving improvement courses; or

subparagraph.name: B
iii
subparagraph.content: the facilities to be provided, the safety measures to be adopted and the equipment to be used in a driving improvement school or taxi service improvement school;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.leadIn: the requirements and procedures— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 55)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for issuing an attendance certificate or course certificate to a person who has attended and completed a driving improvement course; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for issuing a taxi course attendance certificate or taxi course completion certificate to a person who has attended and completed a taxi service improvement course; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: any other matter he considers appropriate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify any form, including the form of any attendance certificate, course certificate, taxi course attendance certificate, taxi course completion certificate or other document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: authorize in writing appropriate persons to sign— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 55)

subparagraph.content: attendance certificates and course certificates; or
taxi course attendance certificates and taxi course completion certificates;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: cause—

subparagraph.content: if a driving improvement school fails to issue an attendance certificate under section 102B(3)(b)(i) or a course certificate under section 102B(3)(b)(ii)—the certificate to be issued for the school; or

if a taxi service improvement school fails to issue a taxi course attendance certificate under section 102B(3A)(b)(i) or a taxi course completion certificate under section 102B(3A)(b)(ii)—the certificate to be issued for the school; and (Replaced 35 of 2023 s. 55)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: recover any expenses incurred by causing a certificate to be issued under paragraph (d) from—

subparagraph.content: the proprietor of the school; or
if the designation of the school has been revoked under section 102C(2) or terminated under section 102D(1)—the last proprietor of the school. (Added 35 of 2023 s. 55)

subsection.leadIn: Any public officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for the purposes of this section may, during the hours when a driving improvement school or taxi service improvement school is open for business, enter the school and, on production of his authorization— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 56)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: inspect the school and ascertain whether there has been a breach of— (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 56)

subparagraph.content: a relevant code of practice;
the condition referred to in section 102B(2)(a)(iii); or
any of the conditions specified under section 102B(2)(a)(iv) in the designation of the school;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: inspect or test any motor vehicle or equipment used for the giving of driving improvement courses or taxi service improvement courses; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: inspect and make copies of any record, book or document kept or maintained in respect of the giving of driving improvement courses or taxi service improvement courses. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 56)

subsection.content: Any person who obstructs a public officer in execution of his duty under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s102G
section.heading: Amendment of Schedule 12
section.content: The Commissioner may by order published in the Gazette amend Schedule 12.

section.name: s102H
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: AttendanceCertificate
def.leadIn: attendance certificate (修習證書)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means an attendance certificate issued under section 102I(3)(c)(i) or 102L(d); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes, except in section 102I(3)(c)(i) or 102L(d), a duplicate of the certificate;

section.def: code of practice (《實務守則》) means a code of practice issued under section 102L(a) as it is in force from time to time;

def.name: CourseCertificate
def.leadIn: course certificate (課程證書)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a course certificate issued under section 102I(3)(c)(ii) or 102L(d); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes, except in section 102I(3)(c)(ii) or 102L(d), a duplicate of the certificate;

section.def: designation (指定) means a designation made under section 102I(1);
proprietor (東主), in relation to a pre-service training school, means a person having the conduct or control of the school, whether or not the person is the owner.

section.name: s102I
section.heading: Commissioner may designate pre-service training schools

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, in writing, designate any place as a pre-service training school for drivers of public service vehicles and may impose any conditions relating to the designation which the Commissioner considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: If a place is designated as a pre-service training school, the designation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: authorizes the person specified in the designation as the proprietor to operate that place as a pre-service training school to provide pre-service courses to drivers of public service vehicles; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is only valid on payment of the fee payable under subsection (5)(a) for the designation.

subsection.leadIn: The proprietor of a pre-service training school must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the school is operated in compliance with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: Schedule 13;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the code of practice; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the conditions specified under subsection (1) in respect of the designation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: pre-service courses are provided at the school in accordance with the code of practice—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to a person who has applied to take a driving test in respect of public light buses, private light buses, public buses, private buses, franchised buses or taxis, or a test in respect of any combination of such types of vehicle;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to a person who has passed a driving test in respect of public light buses, private light buses, public buses, private buses, franchised buses or taxis, or a test in respect of any combination of such types of vehicle;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to a holder of a full driving licence to drive a public light bus, private light bus, public bus, private bus, franchised bus or taxi; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: to a person holding any other driving licence who has been permitted by the Commissioner in writing to take the course; and (Amended L.N. 2 of 2020)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if a person attends and completes a pre-service course at the school—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an attendance certificate in a form specified by the Commissioner is issued for the school to the person immediately afterwards, indicating that the person has attended and completed the course; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a course certificate in a form specified by the Commissioner is issued for the school, on the Commissioner’s direction, to the person, indicating that the person has attended and completed the course in accordance with the code of practice.

subsection.content: The Secretary may by order published in the Gazette amend subsection (3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may from time to time determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fees payable for the designation, or the renewal of the designation, of a pre-service training school; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the maximum fees that may be charged by the proprietor of a pre-service training school for a pre-service course and the issue of an attendance certificate or course certificate.

subsection.content: The fees charged by the proprietor of a pre-service training school for a pre-service course and the issue of an attendance certificate or course certificate must not exceed the maximum fees as determined under subsection (5)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner must cause notice of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the designation of a pre-service training school;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fees determined under subsection (5)(a); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the maximum fees determined under subsection (5)(b),

subsection.continued: to be published in the Gazette.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (7) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 102J and 102K, the designation of a pre-service training school—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is valid for a maximum period of 3 years from the date specified in the designation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, on the application of the proprietor of the school made to the Commissioner at least 3 months before the date of its expiration, be renewed in writing by the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: If a designation is renewed under subsection (9)(b), the renewed designation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is valid for a maximum period of 3 years from the date specified in the renewed designation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is only valid on payment of the fee payable under subsection (5)(a) for the renewal of the designation.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may waive in whole or in part the payment of a fee payable under subsection (5)(a) if the Commissioner considers that it is in the public interest to do so.

subsection.leadIn: If in respect of a pre-service training school it appears to the Commissioner that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proprietor has contravened section 102I(3) or (6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proprietor has issued any attendance certificate or course certificate improperly;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the proprietor has entered any incorrect particulars on an attendance certificate or course certificate for fraudulent purposes;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the proprietor has ceased to have the conduct or control of the school; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the proprietor is being wound up or grounds exist for a creditor to present a bankruptcy petition against the proprietor,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may serve a notice in writing on the proprietor.

subsection.leadIn: A notice served under subsection (1) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the Commissioner’s intention to revoke the designation of the school and the ground for the intention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: state that the proprietor may make representations in writing, within 28 days after the service of the notice, why the designation should not be revoked.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice has been served on the proprietor of a pre-service training school under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the proprietor does not make any representations in writing why the designation should not be revoked within the period specified in subsection (2)(b); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Commissioner, having considered any representations made by the proprietor, is of the opinion that the proprietor has not shown good cause why the designation should not be revoked,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may, by notice in writing served on the proprietor, revoke the designation with effect from the date specified in the notice, being a date later than 14 days after the service of the notice.

subsection.content: The proprietor of a pre-service training school aggrieved by a decision of the Commissioner under subsection (3) may appeal to a Transport Tribunal against the decision within 14 days after the service of the notice of the decision.

subsection.leadIn: If a decision of the Commissioner is appealed against under subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Transport Tribunal may on the appeal affirm, amend or reverse the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the decision does not have effect pending the determination of the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: If the designation of a pre-service training school is revoked—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: no compensation is payable to the proprietor of the school in respect of the revocation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no fee paid under section 102I(2)(b) or (10)(b) is to be refunded.

subsection.content: Within 28 days after the revocation of the designation of a pre-service training school has come into effect, the last proprietor of the school must refund a person the fee that person has paid for taking a pre-service course at the school for any part of the course which has not been given.
The revocation of the designation of a pre-service training school does not affect the validity of attendance certificates or course certificates which have been issued lawfully for the school.

Despite section 102J, if the proprietor of a pre-service training school gives the Commissioner not less than 3 months’ notice in writing of termination, the designation of the school is terminated on the expiry of the period of the notice.

On the termination of a designation, the Commissioner may make a refund in respect of any fee paid under section 102I(2)(b) or (10)(b) of an amount not exceeding the amount obtained by dividing the amount of the fee paid by the number of complete months of the validity period of the designation and multiplying the result by the number of complete months in the unexpired period of the designation.

Within 28 days after the designation in respect of a pre-service training school is terminated, the last proprietor of the school must refund a person the fee that person has paid for taking a pre-service course at the school for any part of the course which has not been given.
The termination of the designation of a pre-service training school does not affect the validity of attendance certificates or course certificates which have been issued lawfully for the school.

section.name: s102L
section.heading: Ancillary powers of Commissioner
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, the Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: issue, and from time to time revise, a code of practice setting out—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the requirements, procedures and standards in respect of the content and duration of pre-service courses;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: the facilities to be provided, the safety measures to be adopted and the equipment to be used in a pre-service training school;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the requirements and procedures for issuing an attendance certificate or a course certificate to a person who has attended and completed a pre-service course; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: any other matter the Commissioner considers appropriate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify any form, including the form of any attendance certificate, course certificate or other document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: authorize in writing persons to sign attendance certificates and course certificates; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: (if the proprietor of a pre-service training school fails to issue an attendance certificate under section 102I(3)(c)(i) or a course certificate under section 102I(3)(c)(ii)) cause the certificate to be issued for the school, and recover any expenses incurred from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the proprietor of the school; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (if the designation of the school has been revoked under section 102J(3) or terminated under section 102K(1)) the last proprietor of the school.

subsection.leadIn: Any public officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner for the purposes of this section may, during the hours when a pre-service training school is open for business, enter the school and, on production of the Commissioner’s authorization—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: observe and monitor the giving of pre-service courses;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inspect the school for the purpose of ascertaining whether there has been a contravention of section 102I(3) or (6);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: inspect or test any motor vehicle or equipment used for the giving of pre-service courses; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: inspect and make copies of any record, book or document kept or maintained in respect of the giving of pre-service courses.

subsection.content: Any person who obstructs a public officer in exercise of the public officer’s power under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s102N
section.heading: Amendment of Schedule 13
section.content: The Commissioner may by order published in the Gazette amend Schedule 13.

part.name: P11
part.heading: Removal, Detention and Disposal of Vehicles

subsection.leadIn: A police officer in uniform of the rank of sergeant or above may take all reasonable steps to remove or cause to be removed, and where necessary may provide for the safe custody of, any vehicle which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contravenes any of the provisions of this Ordinance or of the Fixed Penalty (Traffic Contraventions) Ordinance (Cap. 237); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remains at rest on a road in such conditions or in such circumstances as to be likely to cause danger to other persons using the road or to interfere with the use of the road.

subsection.leadIn: The power of removal contained in subsection (1) shall be exercised only when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vehicle is unattended and the driver cannot be located; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the driver is unable to remove the vehicle; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the driver refuses to remove the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: Any police officer may remove or cause to be removed and where necessary may provide for the safe custody of any vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which has broken down on a road; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which has been involved in an accident,

subsection.continued: if the driver is unable to move the vehicle to a safe place or fails to do so on being requested to do so by a police officer.

section.name: s104
section.heading: Detention of vehicles
section.leadIn: Any vehicle removed under section 103 may be detained by the Commissioner of Police until it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: returned to the owner under section 105; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disposed of under section 106.

subsection.content: A vehicle detained under section 104 shall be returned to the owner on payment of the removal and storage charges specified in Schedule 5.
The Chief Executive in Council may by order published in the Gazette amend Schedule 5. (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)

subsection.leadIn: If a vehicle detained under section 104 is not claimed within 3 days the Commissioner of Police shall serve on the registered owner a notice in writing informing him that unless he—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pays to the Commissioner of Police the removal and storage charges specified in Schedule 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: removes the vehicle from the place of detention within 14 days of the service of the notice on him,

subsection.continued: the vehicle will become the property of the Government.

subsection.content: If a vehicle is not removed within 14 days of the service of a notice under subsection (1) it shall become the property of the Government and may be sold or otherwise disposed of as the Commissioner of Police thinks fit.

Where any vehicle has been permitted to remain stationary on any road in such a position or in such condition or in such circumstances that there is reasonable cause to believe the vehicle to have been abandoned, any police officer or public officer authorized in writing in that behalf by the Commissioner of Police may cause a notice to be given, requiring the person in whose name the vehicle is registered to remove it or cause it to be removed.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) shall be addressed to the person in whose name the vehicle is registered and shall be given—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by sending it to him by registered post at the address shown on the register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by affixing it to the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: The notice shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: require the person in whose name the vehicle is registered to move or cause it to be moved to a place which is not on any road—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the notice is sent by registered post, within 7 days of its service on him; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the notice is affixed to the vehicle, within 7 days of the date on which it is so affixed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: state that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: unless the vehicle is removed within the time so stated, the vehicle will be seized by the Commissioner of Police and removed to a place specified in the notice; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the vehicle is not claimed within a period of 14 days from the date of seizure, it will become the property of the Government. (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)

subsection.content: If the vehicle is not removed as required by a notice given under subsection (1) any police officer of the rank of sergeant or above, or public officer authorized in writing in that behalf by the Commissioner of Police may seize it and may take all reasonable steps to remove it or cause it to be removed to the place specified in the notice.

If a vehicle which is seized and removed under subsection (4) is not claimed within 14 days of its seizure, it shall become the property of the Government and may be sold or otherwise disposed of as the Commissioner of Police thinks fit. (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)

section.name: s108
section.heading: Application of Part 11
section.content: This Part applies to the load carried by any vehicle to the like extent as it applies to the vehicle itself.

section.name: s109
section.heading: Road users’ code and codes of practice

subsection.content: The Secretary may cause to be prepared a code (in this section referred to as the road users’ code) comprising such directions as appear to him to be proper for the guidance of persons using roads and may from time to time revise the code by revoking, varying, amending or adding to the directions therein in such manner as he thinks fit. (Amended 89 of 1994 s. 24; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; 6 of 2012 s. 2)

The road users’ code and any alterations proposed to be made in the provisions of the code on any revision thereof shall as soon as approved by the Secretary be laid before the Legislative Council. (Amended 89 of 1994 s. 24; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; 6 of 2012 s. 2)

The Director of Highways may by notice in the Gazette, prescribe and from time to time revise a code of practice for the lighting, signing and guarding of road works. (Amended 66 of 1984 s. 11; L.N. 127 of 1986)
The Commissioner may by notice in the Gazette prescribe and from time to time revise a code of practice for the loading of vehicles.

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may by notice in the Gazette prescribe and from time to time revise a code of practice comprising such directions as appear to him to be proper for the guidance of owners of private roads in relation to any regulations made under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 11 which relate to traffic signs or road markings; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 121 which relate to signs or road markings within the meaning of that section. (Added 80 of 1988 s. 10)

subsection.content: A failure on the part of any person to observe any provisions of the road users’ code and any code prescribed under subsection (3) or (4) shall not of itself render that person liable to criminal proceedings of any kind but any such failure may in any proceedings whether civil or criminal and including proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance be relied upon by any party to the proceedings as tending to establish or negative any liability which is in question in those proceedings.

For the purpose of section 34 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), the road users’ code prescribed under subsection (1), a code issued after the commencement* of the Road Traffic (Amendment)(No. 2) Ordinance 1994 (89 of 1994), and any alterations of such road users’ code shall be deemed to be subsidiary legislation. (Added 89 of 1994 s. 24)

section.name: s110
section.heading: Variation of traffic signs and road markings
section.content: A traffic sign or road marking which is placed on or in a road and is similar to a prescribed traffic sign or prescribed road marking, as the case may be, shall be deemed to be a prescribed traffic sign or prescribed road marking and to have been lawfully so placed unless the contrary is proved, and the fact that a traffic sign or road marking differs slightly in positioning, size, colour or type from a prescribed traffic sign or prescribed road marking shall not prevent such traffic sign or road marking from being a prescribed traffic sign or prescribed road marking, as the case may be, so long as it is visible and the general appearance and meaning of the sign or marking is not thereby materially impaired.

section.name: s110A
section.heading: Commissioner may specify form of electronic driving licence etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the form of an electronic driving licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the form of an electronic driving instructor’s licence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: one or more electronic platforms through which an electronic driving licence or an electronic driving instructor’s licence is obtained and displayed.

subsection.content: The Commissioner must publish a notice under subsection (1) on the website of the Transport Department or in any other way that the Commissioner considers appropriate.
A notice under subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s110B
section.heading: Circumstances under which persons regarded as having not produced electronic driving licence etc.
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a person is to be regarded as having not produced his or her electronic driving licence or electronic driving instructor’s licence to another person (latter) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence is not displayed on an electronic device through an electronic platform specified under section 110A(1)(c);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licence cannot be read or scanned by the latter because of a defect of the electronic device on which the licence is purportedly displayed; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person fails to comply with a reasonable request by the latter to facilitate the reading or scanning of the licence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, with intent to deceive—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forges, or alters, or uses, or lends to or allows to be used by any other person, a document or other thing to which this subsection applies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes or has in his or her possession any document or other thing so closely resembling a document or other thing to which this subsection applies as to be calculated to deceive,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 years. (Replaced 26 of 2025 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies to the following documents and other things—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any licence, permit, certificate, notice or other document issued or required to be produced under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any registration mark;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any identifying mark applied to a vehicle by a manufacturer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any markings or particulars required to be marked on a vehicle under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any domestic driving licence or permit or international driving permit issued in a country or place outside Hong Kong; (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: any electronic driving licence; (Added 26 of 2025 s. 10)

paragraph.name: eb
paragraph.content: any electronic driving instructor's licence; and (Added 26 of 2025 s. 10)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any document or certificate issued by the manufacturer of a vehicle or any other authority relating to the construction or equipment of the vehicle. (Amended 66 of 1984 s. 12) [cf. 1972 c. 20 s. 169 U.K.]

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: Any person who, with intent to deceive—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forges a display ticket; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes or has in his possession any document so closely resembling a display ticket as to be calculated to deceive,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 years. (Added 61 of 1991 s. 4. Amended 25 of 2020 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: A person who, for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: obtaining any driving licence, vehicle licence, permit, certificate or other document under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: effecting any transfer of ownership of a motor vehicle, to himself or to any other person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: obtaining any variation of any such document;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: any other application or notification required to be made or given under this Ordinance, (Added 66 of 1984 s. 12)

subsection.continued: knowingly makes any statement which is false in a material particular commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months. [cf. 1930 c. 43 s. 112 U.K.]

subsection.content: If it appears to the Commissioner that any declaration or statement made by the person to whom a licence, permit, certificate, notice or other document was issued under this Ordinance, for the purpose of obtaining the issue or variation of such document was false in a material particular, the Commissioner, after giving to such person not less than 7 days’ notice in writing of his intention so to do, may cancel such document, and if such person fails to deliver such document to the Commissioner within 10 days of receiving such notice, he commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 1.

In any proceedings under this Ordinance, the fact that a driving licence has been granted to a person shall be evidence that that person for the purpose of obtaining that driving licence made a declaration that he was not disqualified for holding or obtaining the driving licence.

section.name: s111A
section.heading: Forgery and misuse of toll tag and similar device

subsection.leadIn: A person must not, without lawful authority or reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: tamper or interfere with a toll tag so that the toll tag, or any data stored in the toll tag, is altered;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: drive or be in charge of a vehicle in connection with which any of the following is used—

subparagraph.content: a toll tag if it, or any data stored in it, is altered; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: have in the person’s possession—

subparagraph.content: a toll tag if it, or any data stored in it, is altered.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

section.name: s112
section.heading: Power of Chief Executive to give directions to Commissioner, etc.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may give to the Commissioner and any other public officer, such directions as he thinks fit with respect to the exercise or performance of their respective powers, functions and duties under this Ordinance, either generally or in any particular case.

The Commissioner and the other public officer shall, in the exercise or performance of their respective powers, functions and duties under this Ordinance, comply with any directions given by the Chief Executive under subsection (1).

Schedule 6 shall have effect for the purposes of transition to the provisions of this Ordinance from the provisions of the repealed Ordinance and shall be in addition to and shall not derogate from section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).
The Chief Executive may by order amend Schedule 6. (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)

section.name: s113B
section.heading: Transitional provisions regarding reckless driving causing death and reckless driving

subsection.leadIn: The repeal of sections 36 and 37 by section 2 of the Road Traffic (Amendment) Ordinance 2000 (33 of 2000) (the amending Ordinance) does not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: affect any liability incurred under the repealed section 36 or 37; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: affect—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any penalty or disqualification imposed; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any investigation or criminal proceedings instituted,

paragraph.continued: in respect of any offence committed before the commencement* of the amending Ordinance against the repealed section 36 or 37; and any such penalty or disqualification may be imposed, and any investigation or criminal proceedings may be instituted or carried on in respect of such offence, as if the amending Ordinance had not been passed.

subsection.content: A person may be convicted of an offence under the repealed section 36 notwithstanding that the death of another person as referred to in the repealed section 36(1) occurs on or after the commencement of the amending Ordinance.
Subsections (1) and (2) shall be in addition to and shall not derogate from section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s113C
section.heading: Transitional provisions relating to Road Traffic (Amendment) Ordinance 2017

subsection.leadIn: A motor vehicle that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: constructed or adapted for the carriage of a driver and a maximum of 17, 18 or 19 passengers; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: registered as a private bus or public bus under this Ordinance immediately before the commencement* of the Road Traffic (Amendment) Ordinance 2017 (10 of 2017),

subsection.continued: retains its registration as such, unless its owner applies for its re-registration as a vehicle within another class.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, a motor vehicle that retains its registration as a private bus or public bus by virtue of subsection (1) continues to fall within the definition of private bus or public bus (as the case may be) in section 2.
The enactments listed in the first column of Schedule 7 are amended in the manner set out in the second column of Schedule 7.
In any law, for any reference to the Public Omnibus Services Ordinance 1975 (59 of 1975), there is substituted a reference to the Public Bus Services Ordinance (Cap. 230). (Amemded 13 of 2024 s. 61)
The Chief Executive may by order amend Schedule 7 so as to amend references in any enactment to subsidiary legislation made under the repealed Ordinance. (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)

Part IX of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132) and the Advertisements Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. B) shall not apply to the use of any part of a parking meter for advertising purposes. (Amended 78 of 1999 s. 7)
The Commissioner may use or permit the use of any part of a parking meter for advertising purposes on such terms and conditions and for such period as he thinks fit.

Where there is a parking meter management agreement or vehicle examination centre management agreement between the Government and any person, and the terms of the agreement have been approved by the Financial Secretary for the purposes of this section, those parts or percentages of any moneys raised or received for the purposes of the Government under the agreement which that person is entitled under the agreement to retain by way of remuneration or reimbursement shall not form part of the general revenue for the purposes of section 3(1) of the Public Finance Ordinance (Cap. 2).

Subsection (1) applies in relation to a parking meter management agreement or vehicle examination centre management agreement entered into before the commencement* of Part IV of the Road Traffic (Amendment) Ordinance 1999 (50 of 1999) as it applies in relation to such an agreement entered into on or after that commencement, but nothing in this section shall be construed as applying to any moneys raised or received for the purposes of the Government before the date of the approval of the Financial Secretary under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: parking meter management agreement (停車收費錶管理協議) means an agreement entered into by any person with the Government authorizing that person to undertake such functions relating to parking meters as are specified by the Commissioner and on such terms and conditions as are imposed by the Commissioner;
vehicle examination centre management agreement (驗車中心管理協議) means an agreement under section 88(3) authorizing a person to operate a place as a vehicle examination centre.

section.name: s116
section.heading: This Part not to apply to certain private roads

subsection.content: The Secretary may, by notice in the Gazette, specify private roads to which this Part shall not apply subject to such conditions, if any, as are specified in the notice. (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; 6 of 2012 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) may specify the private roads to which it relates by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: naming such roads;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: describing the area within which such roads are situated; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: reference to a plan,

subsection.continued: or any combination thereof.

section.name: s117
section.heading: Application of Ordinance to private roads

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the other provisions of this Ordinance which relate, in any way, to those sections; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provisions of any other Ordinance which relate, in any way, to those sections or to the provisions referred to in paragraph (a),

section.name: s118
section.heading: Application of regulations to private roads

subsection.leadIn: Subject to any regulations made in pursuance of subsection (2), all regulations made under this Ordinance (except section 12) shall apply to private roads as they apply to roads and, for that purpose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the other provisions of this Ordinance which relate, in any way, to such regulations which apply to private roads; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provisions of any other Ordinance which relate, in any way, to such regulations which apply to private roads or to the provisions referred to in paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: shall apply accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: Where any power is conferred by this Ordinance (except section 12) to make regulations, such power shall include the power to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify that all or any regulations made in pursuance of that power shall not apply to private roads; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: modify or qualify the application to private roads of all or any regulations made in pursuance of that power.

section.name: s119
section.heading: Proof of certain offences which apply to private roads as they apply to roads
section.content: Where any provision of this or any other Ordinance creates an offence an element of which is that the offence occurs on or in relation to a place which is a road or private road, then, without prejudice to the proof of any other elements of that offence, it shall be sufficient in any proceedings alleging the commission of that offence for the prosecution to show that the place where that offence was committed was either a road or private road, without showing that the place was one or the other, and a charge alleging the commission of that offence may be framed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), where any provision of this Ordinance (except section 36, 36A, 37, 38, 39, 39A, 39B, 39C, 39J, 39K, 39L, 39O, 39S, 56, 57, 61, 63 or 80), or any other Ordinance, creates an offence an element of which is that the offence occurs on or in relation to a place which is a private road, and irrespective of whether that offence may also occur on or in relation to a place which is a road, then, without— (Amended 39 of 1995 s. 13; 19 of 2010 s. 21; 24 of 2011 s. 19)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prejudice to the proof of any other elements of that offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: limiting the generality of any other defence, or affecting any other charge which may be laid, under any provision of this Ordinance or any other Ordinance,

subsection.continued: it shall be a defence in any proceedings alleging the commission of that offence for the defendant to show that the private road where that offence was committed was within—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: an area wholly or mainly used for the carrying on of construction work; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: an area wholly or mainly used for the carrying on of industry.

subsection.content: Where in any proceedings alleging the commission of an offence referred to in section 119 the prosecution shows that the place where that offence was committed was either a road or private road, without showing that the place was one or the other, subsection (1) shall not apply in relation to those proceedings unless the defendant first shows that the place was a private road.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

def.name: ConstructionWork
def.leadIn: construction work (建造工程) means any one or more of the following activities—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: building works;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: works associated with the provision of utilities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: road works;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: reclamation;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: dumping;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: quarrying; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: an activity declared under subsection (4) to be construction work;

def.name: Industry
def.leadIn: industry (工業) means any one or more of the following activities—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the manufacture of articles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any process by which articles are altered, repaired or broken up;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the generation of power;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the loading, unloading or handling of articles or cargo at any dock, quay or wharf or in any warehouse;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the storage of goods or cargo;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: shipbuilding; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: an activity declared under subsection (4) to be industry.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, the Chief Executive may, by notice in the Gazette, declare an activity to be— (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: construction work; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: industry.

section.name: s121
section.heading: Regulation of parking on private roads

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: sign (標誌) means a sign, object or device for conveying to persons using a private road any warning, information, direction, requirement, restriction or prohibition.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may make regulations to enable owners of private roads to— (Amended 89 of 1994 s. 25; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; 6 of 2012 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: use immobilisation devices, approved by the Commissioner, for the purposes of paragraph (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: deliver into the custody of the Commissioner of Police, in such circumstances as are specified in the regulations, vehicles detained under the regulations where any charge referred to in paragraph (b) incurred in respect of any such vehicle is not paid within such period as is specified in the regulations;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: require a person who has erected or placed on the road a sign or road marking in contravention of the regulations to remove it;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: recover as a civil debt from a person referred to in paragraph (e) the cost of removing a sign or road marking referred to in that paragraph;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: delegate to any person any powers conferred on them under the regulations; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: appoint persons to be authorized officers for the purposes of the regulations and to issue identity cards to such officers,

subsection.continued: and may make any other regulations necessary or convenient to be made for the purposes of any of the matters referred to in paragraphs (a) to (h) inclusive, including regulations—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: providing for vehicles referred to in paragraph (d) delivered into the custody of the Commissioner of Police to become the property of the Government free from the rights of any person and for empowering the Commissioner of Police to dispose of such vehicles by sale or otherwise as he thinks fit; (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: for the forfeiture of a sign referred to in paragraph (e);

paragraph.name: iii
iv
paragraph.content: providing for the Commissioner to specify particulars to be contained in identity cards referred to in paragraph (h); and

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: specifying private roads to which the regulations shall not apply.

section.name: s122
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: Director means the Director of Highways;
expressway (快速公路) means any expressway designated as such by the Commissioner as an expressway under section 123(1) and delineated as such on a deposited plan, and includes any part of an expressway;

expressway plant and equipment (快速公路裝置及裝備) means any apparatus, cable, casing, conduit, duct, machinery, pipe, post, structure, traffic sign, tube, utility or other thing comprising or forming part of, or used in connection with, any expressway works, but does not include a vehicle;

def.name: ExpresswayWorks
def.leadIn: expressway works (快速公路工程), in relation to an expressway, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any works of alteration, closure, construction, diversion, demolition, excavation, inspection, installation, investigation, maintenance, reinstatement, renovation, repair or survey in, on, over or under that expressway or beneath the physical structure of that expressway;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other works designated as expressway works by the Secretary for the purposes of this definition by notice in the Gazette; and (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; 6 of 2012 s. 2)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any operations ancillary or incidental thereto;

section.def: unleased Government land (未批租政府土地) has the meaning assigned to it by regulation 29 of the Road Traffic (Traffic Control) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. G); (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)

utility (公用設施) means any electric power cable, telephone cable or other cable used in communication, any telecommunications apparatus, and any pipe used in the supply of water, gas or oil, or for drainage or sewerage, together with any cable, duct or pipe and any ancillary apparatus in respect thereof.

section.name: s123
section.heading: Designation of expressways and determination of boundaries

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, designate any road and any unleased Government land which is not a road immediately adjacent thereto (including any access thereto or exit therefrom) as an expressway and may, by notice in the Gazette, amend or revoke any such designation. (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)
The Commissioner shall determine the boundaries of any expressway designated under subsection (1) and may vary in whole or in part any such determination.

Where a determination of boundaries is made under subsection (2), or any such determination is varied under that subsection, the Director of Lands shall prepare a plan or plans delineating the boundaries, as so determined or varied, of that expressway. (Amended L.N. 291 of 1993)
Every plan prepared under this section shall be numbered, dated, signed by the Director of Lands and deposited in the Land Registry. (Amended 8 of 1993 s. 2; L.N. 291 of 1993; 21 of 2024 s. 78)

subsection.def: In this section road (道路) does not include any road or portion of a road which comprises a footway within the meaning of regulation 2 of the Road Traffic (Traffic Control) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. G), any pedestrian road within the meaning of regulation 29 of those regulations, or any road or portion of a road set aside for bicycles or tricycles.

subsection.content: In any proceedings before a court a copy of a deposited plan, certified by the Director of Lands to be a copy of that plan, shall be proof that the road (within the meaning of section 123(5)) and any unleased Government land which is not a road immediately adjacent thereto and comprised within the boundaries of an expressway delineated as such on that copy is an expressway. (Amended 29 of 1998 s. 105)

A copy of a deposited plan purporting to be certified by the Director of Lands under subsection (1) shall, on its production to the court by any public officer, be admitted in evidence without further proof and shall be presumed to have been so certified.

section.name: s125
section.heading: No expressway works to be carried out without consent

subsection.content: Notwithstanding the provisions of any other Ordinance and subject to subsection (2), no person shall carry out, or cause to be carried out, any expressway works unless he first obtains the written authorization (whether by permit or otherwise) of the Director issued in accordance with regulations made under section 131 and containing such conditions as the Director sees fit to impose in respect of those works or in respect of any vehicle used, or to be used, in connection with those works.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to any person carrying out, or causing to carry out, any expressway works which may be necessary in the event of an accident or emergency, but the person responsible for those expressway works shall—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
iii
subparagraph.content: carry out, or cause to be carried out, those works in accordance with that consent or permission; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: within one working day of the accident or emergency, apply to the Director for the issue of a written authorization (whether by permit or otherwise) in accordance with regulations made under section 131 and containing such conditions as the Director sees fit to impose in respect of those works or in respect of any vehicle used, or to be used, in connection with those works; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to any relevant person carrying out, or causing to carry out, any expressway works which comprise only inspections, investigations or surveys in respect of an expressway, or to any vehicle used, or to be used, by that person in connection with those works.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsections (1) and (2), the conditions that the Director may impose under subsection (1) or (2)(a)(iv) may include conditions which seek to ensure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the safety of persons using the expressway or carrying out expressway works;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the quality and satisfactory condition of those expressway works; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the minimum disruption to vehicular traffic using the expressway.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to obtain a written authorization of the Director under subsection (1) or (2)(a)(iv);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to comply with that written authorization, or any condition imposed by the Director under those subsections; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fails to comply with any of the requirements of subsection (2)(a)(i), (ii), (iii) or (iv),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable in the case of a first conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months, and in the case of a second or subsequent conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 12 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a failure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to obtain a written authorization of the Director under subsection (1) or (2)(a)(iv); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to comply with that written authorization, or any condition imposed by the Director under those subsections,

subsection.continued: the Director may, if the person responsible for the expressway works defaults, complete those works or rectify any deficiency in respect of those works and the person responsible for those works shall pay to the Director the costs incurred for such completion or rectification.

subsection.content: Any costs incurred by the Director under subsection (5) shall be recoverable as a civil debt.

def.name: RelevantPerson
def.leadIn: In this section, relevant person (有關人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the Director, any public officer authorized (by name or office) by the Director or any other person authorized by the Director; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Commissioner of Police, any police officer in uniform or any other person authorized by the Commissioner of Police.

section.name: s126
section.heading: Removal of expressway plant and equipment causing a danger or an obstruction

subsection.content: The Director, any public officer authorized (by name or office) by the Director or any police officer in uniform (the relevant officer) may take all reasonable steps to remove, or cause to be removed, and where necessary may provide for the safe custody of, any expressway plant and equipment which is in, on, over or under an expressway or beneath the physical structure of an expressway and in such a condition or in such circumstances as to be likely to cause danger to persons using the expressway or to interfere with the use of the expressway.

subsection.leadIn: The power of removal contained in subsection (1) shall be exercised only when—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the owner or other person in charge or possession of the expressway plant and equipment is unable to remove it; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the owner or other person in charge or possession of the expressway plant and equipment refuses to remove it on being requested to do so by the relevant officer.

subsection.content: The relevant officer may remove, or cause to be removed, and where necessary may provide for the safe custody of any expressway plant and equipment which has been involved in an accident if the owner or other person in charge or possession of that plant and equipment is unable to move it to a safe place or fails to do so on being requested to do so by the relevant officer.

section.name: s127
section.heading: Detention of expressway plant and equipment
section.leadIn: Any expressway plant and equipment removed under section 126 may be detained by the Director or the Commissioner of Police, as the case may be, until it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: returned under section 128 to the owner or to such other person as the owner may authorize in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disposed of under section 129.

section.name: s128
section.heading: Expressway plant and equipment returned to owner

subsection.content: Any expressway plant and equipment detained under section 127 shall be returned to the owner or to such other person as the owner may authorize in writing on payment to the Director or the Commissioner of Police, as the case may be, of any removal and storage costs incurred in such removal and storage.
Any costs incurred by the Director or the Commissioner of Police, as the case may be, under subsection (1) shall be recoverable from the owner as a civil debt.

section.name: s129
section.heading: Disposal of unclaimed expressway plant and equipment

subsection.leadIn: If any expressway plant and equipment detained under section 127 is not claimed within 3 days the Director or the Commissioner of Police, as the case may be, shall serve on the owner of such plant and equipment, or on such other person in charge or possession of it at the time of its removal under section 126, a notice informing him that unless he—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pays to the Director or the Commissioner of Police, as the case may be, any removal and storage costs incurred in such removal and storage; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after such payment, removes the expressway plant and equipment from the place of detention within 14 days of the service of the notice on him,

subsection.continued: the expressway plant and equipment shall become the property of the Government.

subsection.content: If any expressway plant and equipment is not removed within 14 days of the service of a notice under subsection (1) it shall become the property of the Government and may be sold or otherwise disposed of as the Director or the Commissioner of Police, as the case may be, thinks fit.

Any costs incurred by the Director, or the Commissioner of Police, as the case may be, under this section or section 128(2), and not recovered under this section by the sale or disposal of the plant and equipment under this section, shall be recoverable from the owner or former owner, as the case may be, as a civil debt.

section.name: s130
section.heading: Access to and exit from an expressway

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), any person who drives a vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on to an expressway other than by way of an expressway access; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: off an expressway other than by way of an expressway exit,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 2 and imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2021)

subsection.content: Subsection (1) shall not apply to any person lawfully driving a vehicle on an occasion when it is being used for fire services, ambulance or police purposes or is being used in connection with the carrying out of any expressway works authorized under section 125, if compliance with subsection (1) would be likely to hinder the use of the vehicle on that occasion for any of those purposes.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may make regulations to provide for— (Amended 89 of 1994 s. 26; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; 6 of 2012 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
c
paragraph.content: controlling, regulating and restricting pedestrian movements on an expressway;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prohibiting, controlling and regulating the use of an expressway by all or any specified type or class or description of vehicle;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: the issue, display, surrender and cancellation of any written authorization, consent or permission (whether described as a permit or otherwise) of the Director in respect of any expressway works and the imposition at the discretion of the Director of any conditions in respect thereof or in respect of any vehicle used, or to be used, in connection therewith;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: controlling and regulating any persons carrying out expressway works and any vehicles used, or to be used, in connection therewith;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: controlling and regulating the use or operation of recovery vehicles on an expressway;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: prohibiting, controlling and restricting animals on an expressway;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the total or partial closure of an expressway including any expressway access or expressway exit;

paragraph.name: l
m
paragraph.content: exempting persons or vehicles, or any type or class or description of vehicle from the operation of any regulation (including any condition imposed by such regulation) whether by permit or otherwise and, in the case of the issue of a permit, the fees if any) payable for such issue; and (Amended 89 of 1994 s. 26)

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: generally carrying into effect the provisions of this Part relating to the regulation of traffic on an expressway.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations to provide for— (Amended 3 of 2002 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fees to be charged for the issue by the Director of any written authorization, consent or permission (whether described as a permit or otherwise) in respect of any expressway works or in respect of any vehicle used, or to be used, in connection with those works, the provision by the Director of lanterns, road markings and traffic signs for the purpose of lighting, signing and guarding those works or vehicles and the fees for any other matter under the regulations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the waiving, exemption, reduction or refund of fees. (Added 89 of 1994 s. 26)

section.name: s132
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 15
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: AV certificate (自動車證書) means a certificate issued under a provision of the Pilot Regulation made pursuant to section 139(1)(a)(ii);
AV scheme (自動車計劃) means a scheme under which AVs are operated on roads;
backup operator (後備操作員), in relation to an AV, means an in-vehicle backup operator or remote backup operator;
disapplication notice (改變效力公告) means a notice made under section 146(1)(a), (b) or (c);

in-vehicle backup operator (車上後備操作員), in relation to an AV, means a natural person in or on the AV who—(a)monitors the AV and its surrounding with a view to, if necessary, overriding the AV system of the AV by taking control (in whole or in part) of the AV; or(b)when the AV ceases to operate in autonomous mode, manually operates the AV;
non-pilot use (非先導使用), in relation to an AV, means a use of the AV that is not a pilot use;
pilot AV (先導自動車) means an AV for which there is a valid AV certificate;
pilot licence (先導牌照) means a licence issued under a provision of the Pilot Regulation made pursuant to section 139(1)(a)(i);

pilot participant (先導參與者) means—(a)a pilot proprietor; or(b)any other person participating in a pilot scheme, such as—(i)the manufacturer of a pilot AV under the scheme or the manufacturer of the AV system of such a pilot AV; or(ii)a backup operator of a pilot AV under the scheme;
Pilot Regulation (《先導規例》) means regulations made under section 138;
pilot scheme (先導計劃) means an AV scheme for which there is a valid pilot licence;
pilot use (先導使用)—see section 135;

remote backup operator (遙距後備操作員), in relation to an AV, means a natural person who—(a)is not in or on the AV; but(b)remotely monitors the AV and its surrounding with a view to, if necessary, overriding the AV system of the AV by taking control (in whole or in part) of the AV;
road (道路) includes a private road;

traffic provision (交通條文) means a provision of this Ordinance or any of the following Ordinances—(a)the Tramway Ordinance (Cap. 107);(b)the Public Bus Services Ordinance (Cap. 230);(c)the Fixed Penalty (Traffic Contraventions) Ordinance (Cap. 237);(d)the Fixed Penalty (Criminal Proceedings) Ordinance (Cap. 240);(e)the Road Tunnels (Government) Ordinance (Cap. 368);(f)the Road Traffic (Driving-offence Points) Ordinance (Cap. 375);(g)(Repealed 3 of 2025 s. 18)(h)the Tsing Ma Control Area Ordinance (Cap. 498);(i)the Discovery Bay Tunnel Link Ordinance (Cap. 520);(j)the Mass Transit Railway Ordinance (Cap. 556);(k)the Tsing Sha Control Area Ordinance (Cap. 594);(l)the Taxi-Driver-Offence Points Ordinance (Cap. 647); (Added 35 of 2023 s. 57. Amended E.R. 5 of 2024)
use (使用), in relation to an AV—see section 134.

subsection.content: The Secretary may by notice published in the Gazette amend Schedule 14, only for the purpose of updating the meaning of autonomous by reference to international or regional standards.

A notice under subsection (1) may contain incidental, consequential, supplemental, transitional or savings provisions that are necessary or expedient in consequence of an amendment made by the notice.

subsection.leadIn: An AV is being used when it is in operation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether by a backup operator or its AV system, or both; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether in autonomous mode or not.

subsection.content: If there is a backup operator for an AV that is being used, the operator is taken to be using the AV.

subsection.leadIn: If an AV is used, in addition to the person who actually permitted the use, for the purposes of section 136(1)(b), the use is also taken to have been permitted by the following person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a pilot AV—

subparagraph.content: the pilot proprietor; or
if the pilot proprietor is not the registered owner of the AV—both the pilot proprietor and the registered owner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an AV that is not a pilot AV—its owner (whether a registered owner or not).

subsection.leadIn: However—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person in or on an AV is not taken to be using the AV if the person is a passenger in or on the AV and is not a backup operator of the AV;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person is not taken to be using an AV only because the person is the owner of the place in which the AV is used; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a person is not taken to have permitted the use of an AV only because the person is—

subparagraph.content: a passenger in or on the AV; or
the owner of the place in which the AV is used.

subsection.leadIn: The use of an AV is a pilot use if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the AV is a pilot AV under a pilot scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the use conforms with—

subparagraph.content: the pilot licence of the scheme and the conditions of the licence; and
the AV certificate of the AV and the conditions of the certificate.

subsection.leadIn: However, a pilot use does not include the towing of a trailer by a pilot AV unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration mark of the trailer is specified in a condition of the AV certificate of the AV; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the towing conforms with—

subparagraph.content: the pilot licence of the relevant pilot scheme and the conditions of the licence; and
the AV certificate and the conditions of the certificate.

subsection.leadIn: No person may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: use an AV; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permit the use of an AV,

subsection.continued: on a road, unless the use is a pilot use.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), a person may use an AV on a road if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a movement permit is issued under regulation 53 of the Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. E) for the AV; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the use conforms with the movement permit and the conditions of the permit.

subsection.content: If a person contravenes subsection (1)(a) or (b), the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s137
section.heading: Defence for pilot proprietors or owners of AVs

subsection.leadIn: If a pilot proprietor of a pilot AV or the owner (whether a registered owner or not) of an AV (defendant)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is taken to have permitted a non-pilot use of the AV because of section 134(3)(a) or (b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is charged with an offence under section 136(3) for contravening section 136(1)(b),

subsection.continued: it is a defence for the defendant to show that the defendant had a specified excuse for the contravention.

subsection.leadIn: A defendant is taken to have shown that the defendant had a specified excuse for contravening section 136(1)(b) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sufficient evidence is adduced to raise an issue that the defendant had such an excuse; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a defendant had a specified excuse for contravening section 136(1)(b) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the defendant exercised all due diligence to prevent the non-pilot use of the relevant AV; and
