paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the non-pilot use happened without the defendant’s consent or connivance.

section.name: s138
section.heading: Secretary may make regulations
section.leadIn: The Secretary may make regulations to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: regulate the carrying out of AV schemes on a pilot basis;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for matters that would facilitate attaining the pilot object; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide for any other matters related to paragraph (a) or (b).

subsection.leadIn: The Pilot Regulation may provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the application, issue, renewal, replacement, variation, transfer, suspension or cancellation of—

subparagraph.content: licences to carry out AV schemes; and
certificates for AVs under such AV schemes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conduct of pilot participants.

subsection.content: The Pilot Regulation may provide for the publication of notices to notify the public of information about pilot licences.
A notice mentioned in subsection (2) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s140
section.heading: Registration, licensing, etc.—special provisions for AVs

subsection.leadIn: The Pilot Regulation may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exempt an AV from a specified provision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disapply a specified provision to or in relation to an AV; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide for the application of a specified provision to or in relation to an AV with exceptions, modifications or adaptations.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), a provision of the Pilot Regulation made pursuant to that subsection may empower the Commissioner, in relation to a particular AV or a particular type of AV, to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: waive or modify any requirement under this Ordinance for registration or licensing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuse, suspend or cancel registration or licensing under specified circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified provision (指明條文) means a provision of this Ordinance relating to registration or licensing of vehicles or limits of the number of vehicles.

subsection.content: Without affecting section 146(1), the Pilot Regulation may provide for how a reference to a driver in any provision of this Ordinance or of any other Ordinance is to be interpreted for an AV.

subsection.leadIn: An interpretative provision may specify that a reference to a driver is taken to be a reference to any one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a backup operator;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a pilot proprietor;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the owner of the relevant AV;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other person specified in the provision.

subsection.content: If the Secretary is not charged with responsibility for the relevant provision, the Secretary must consult the Director of Bureau charged with responsibility for the provision before making an interpretative provision in respect of the provision.

subsection.leadIn: An interpretative provision may specify different persons for different circumstances, and may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: generally; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any particular case, including in relation to (whether in whole or in part) a particular pilot matter.

subsection.leadIn: Unless the Secretary makes an interpretative provision that provides otherwise—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a driver in a provision of this Ordinance or any other Ordinance (driver provision) is, for an AV for which there is a backup operator, taken to be a reference to the backup operator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the backup operator of an AV is, when the AV is in operation, taken to be driving the AV for the purposes of the driver provision.

subsection.leadIn: If the Secretary makes an interpretative provision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a driver in the subject provision is to be interpreted in accordance with the interpretative provision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who is the driver of an AV because of the interpretative provision is, when the AV is in operation, taken to be driving the AV for the purposes of the subject provision.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: interpretative provision (釋義條文) means a provision of the Pilot Regulation made pursuant to subsection (1);
subject provision (關涉條文) means a provision containing a reference to a driver that is interpreted by an interpretative provision.

subsection.leadIn: Without affecting section 146(1), if the Secretary is satisfied that the requirements in subsection (2) are met, the Pilot Regulation may, with or without conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exempt a pilot matter from a provision of this Ordinance or any other Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disapply a provision of this Ordinance or any other Ordinance to or in relation to a pilot matter; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide for the application of a provision of this Ordinance or any other Ordinance to or in relation to a pilot matter with exceptions, modifications or adaptations (modified application).

subsection.leadIn: The requirements are that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the provision concerns safety—there is an alternative measure that would, as regards achieving safety, be at least as effective as the requirements in the provision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: taking into account the scope and nature of the relevant pilot scheme or the nature or technical capabilities of the relevant AV, any of the following circumstances exists—

subparagraph.content: compliance with, or application of, the provision would hinder the attainment of the pilot object or is not necessary;
without the exemption, disapplication or modified application, compliance with, or application of, the provision would be impractical.

subsection.content: If the Secretary is not charged with responsibility for the relevant provision, the Secretary must consult the Director of Bureau charged with responsibility for the provision before making a disapplication provision for the provision.

subsection.leadIn: A disapplication provision may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: generally; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any particular case, including in relation to (whether in whole or in part) a particular pilot matter.

subsection.content: If a person fails to comply with a condition in a disapplication provision, the relevant exemption, disapplication or modified application does not, while the non-compliance continues, operate in the person’s favour.
If, because of subsection (5), the person commits an offence because of the non-compliance, the person may be proceeded against for that offence.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: disapplication provision (改變效力條文) means a provision of the Pilot Regulation made pursuant to subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c).

section.name: s143
section.heading: General provisions of Pilot Regulation
section.leadIn: The Pilot Regulation may provide for the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the general control of the use of AVs;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conduct of any persons (whether pilot participants or not) in relation to the use of AVs;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the construction and maintenance of AVs, AV systems and AV equipment;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the protection of third parties against risks of personal injury or property damage arising out of the use of AVs;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the prohibition of interference with AVs, AV systems and AV equipment;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the maintenance of records relating to AVs, AV systems and AV equipment;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the reporting and investigation of incidents or accidents that involve AVs, AV systems and AV equipment;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the review by a Transport Tribunal of decisions made under the Pilot Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: The Pilot Regulation may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prescribe the fees that may be charged for—

subparagraph.content: the application for and the issue, renewal and replacement of pilot licences and AV certificates; and
any matter arising under the Pilot Regulation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: authorize the Commissioner to waive, exempt, reduce or refund the whole or any part of such fees.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: different fees may be prescribed for different types of pilot licences or different types of AV certificates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: different fees may be prescribed for different circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: A fee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be prescribed at levels which provide for the recovery of expenditure incurred or likely to be incurred by the Government in relation generally to the administration of matters relating to the pilot object; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: need not be limited by reference to the amount of administrative or other costs incurred or likely to be incurred for any particular matter.

section.name: s145
section.heading: Penalties for offences
section.content: The Pilot Regulation may provide that a contravention of any provision of the Regulation is an offence punishable by a fine not exceeding level 4 and imprisonment not exceeding 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner is satisfied that the requirements in subsection (2) are met, the Commissioner may by notice, with or without conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exempt a pilot matter from a traffic provision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disapply a traffic provision to or in relation to a pilot matter; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide for the application of a traffic provision to or in relation to a pilot matter with exceptions, modifications or adaptations (modified application).

subsection.leadIn: The requirements are that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the provision concerns safety—there is an alternative measure that would, as regards achieving safety, be at least as effective as the requirements in the provision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: taking into account the scope and nature of the relevant pilot scheme or the nature or technical capabilities of the relevant AV, any of the following circumstances exists—

subparagraph.content: compliance with, or application of, the provision would hinder the attainment of the pilot object or is not necessary;
without the exemption, disapplication or modified application, compliance with, or application of, the provision would be impractical.

subsection.content: If the Secretary is charged with responsibility for the traffic provision, the Commissioner must consult the Secretary before making a disapplication notice for the provision.

If the Secretary is not charged with responsibility for the traffic provision, the Commissioner must, through the Secretary, consult the Director of Bureau charged with responsibility for the provision before making a disapplication notice for the provision.

A disapplication notice may only be made in relation to a particular case, including in relation to (whether in whole or in part) a particular pilot scheme or a particular pilot matter under a pilot scheme.

To avoid doubt, the Commissioner’s power under this section is in addition to and does not affect the Commissioner’s power under any other traffic provision to disapply any provision or to grant any exemption.

section.name: s147
section.heading: Variation, suspension or revocation of disapplication notices

subsection.content: The Commissioner may vary, suspend or revoke a disapplication notice for any reason, including a reason specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The reasons are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the safety of the pilot matter would be undermined or it would endanger any person or thing if the disapplication notice is not so varied, suspended or revoked; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a condition in the disapplication notice has not been complied with.

subsection.content: A variation or revocation of a disapplication notice under subsection (1) includes varying or revoking a condition in the notice or attaching any new condition to the notice.

section.name: s148
section.heading: Failure to comply with conditions in disapplication notices

subsection.content: If a person fails to comply with a condition in a disapplication notice, the relevant exemption, disapplication or modified application does not, while the non-compliance continues, operate in the person’s favour.
If, because of subsection (1), the person commits an offence because of the non-compliance, the person may be proceeded against for that offence.
A disapplication notice must be published on the website of the Transport Department.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner varies, suspends or revokes a disapplication notice (other than varying or revoking a condition in the notice)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner must publish a notice of the variation, suspension or revocation (notification notice) on the website of the Transport Department; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a variation—the notification notice must state the details of variation.

subsection.content: A disapplication notice and a notification notice are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s150
section.heading: Commissioner may issue codes of practice

subsection.content: The Commissioner may issue a code of practice, direction, guideline or standard for providing practical guidance for any matters under this Part or the Pilot Regulation (collectively be referred to as code of practice).

subsection.leadIn: A code of practice may refer to, apply or incorporate a document that has been formulated, published or specified by the Commissioner either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as in force at the time when the document is referred to, applied or incorporated; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as amended, formulated, published or specified from time to time.

subsection.leadIn: If a code of practice is issued, the Commissioner must by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the code of practice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the code of practice is to take effect.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may from time to time revise or revoke the whole, or any part, of a code of practice issued under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: If a code of practice is revised or revoked under subsection (4), the Commissioner must by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the code of practice, or any part so revised or revoked; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the revision or revocation is to take effect.

subsection.content: A code of practice must be made available for public inspection on the website of the Transport Department.
Different codes of practice may be issued for different matters under this Part or the Pilot Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: The following are not subsidiary legislation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an instrument by which a code of practice is issued;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice mentioned in subsection (3) or (5).

section.name: s151
section.heading: Use of codes of practice in legal proceedings

subsection.content: A failure by a person to observe a provision of a code of practice does not of itself make the person liable to any civil or criminal proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), if in any legal proceedings the court is satisfied that a code of practice or any part of a code of practice is relevant to determining a matter that is in issue in the proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the code of practice or part is admissible in evidence in the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proof that the person contravened or did not contravene a relevant provision of the code of practice may be relied on by a party to the proceedings as tending to establish or negate that matter.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: code of practice (實務守則) means a code of practice, direction, guideline or standard issued under section 150(1);
court (法院) means—(a)a court as defined by section 3 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1);(b)a magistrate; or(c)a Transport Tribunal;
legal proceedings (法律程序) includes the proceedings of a Transport Tribunal.

section.name: s1
section.content: In so far as any order, application, appointment, determination or decision made or having effect as if made, certificate, designation, direction or notice issued, given, or delivered or having effect as if issued, given or delivered, condition imposed or having effect as imposed, or other thing done or having effect as if done under the repealed Ordinance could have been made, issued, given, delivered, imposed or done under a corresponding provision of this Ordinance it shall not be invalidated by the repeal effected by section 115 of this Ordinance, but shall have effect as if made, issued, given, delivered, imposed or done under that corresponding provision.

section.name: s2
section.content: Where any enactment or document refers, whether specifically or by means of a general description to the repealed Ordinance or is to be construed as so referring, the reference shall, except where the context otherwise requires, be construed as, or as including, a reference to the corresponding provision of this Ordinance.

section.name: s3
section.content: Any record kept under the repealed Ordinance shall be deemed to have been kept under the corresponding provisions of this Ordinance.

schedule.name: sch8
schedule.heading: Requirements Applicable to Car Testing Centres

section.name: s1
section.content: A car testing centre shall be equipped, staffed, operated and maintained, and examinations of private cars and light goods vehicles shall be conducted, in accordance with the code of practice issued and from time to time revised by the Commissioner under section 88F(1)(a). (Amended L.N. 207 of 1990)

section.name: s2
section.content: Examinations of private cars and light goods vehicles at the car testing centre shall be carried out only by an approved car tester, and under the general supervision of a responsible person. (Amended L.N. 207 of 1990)

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: Notice shall be given by the proprietor to the Commissioner forthwith of any change—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: of an approved car tester employed at the car testing centre;

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: of a responsible person employed at the car testing centre; and

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: in the ownership of the car testing centre, or the financial status of the proprietor, or any other matter specified by the Commissioner.

section.name: s4
section.content: Subject to any practice laid down in the code of practice, the car testing centre shall examine any private car or light goods vehicle produced to it for examination for the purposes of Part 9A of the Ordinance. (Amended L.N. 207 of 1990)

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: Notices in a form approved by the Commissioner shall be prominently displayed at the car testing centre indicating and stating—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: that the place is a car testing centre;

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: the hours that the car testing centre is open for business;

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: the names of the approved car testers, and of the responsible person at the car testing centre;

subsection.name: d
subsection.content: the fees that are charged at the car testing centre;

subsection.name: e
subsection.content: the addresses of other car testing centres within Hong Kong;

subsection.name: f
subsection.content: the circumstances under which the issue of a certificate of roadworthiness may be refused;

subsection.name: g
h
subsection.content: a warning against the commission of offences under the Prevention of Bribery Ordinance (Cap. 201) and the Independent Commission Against Corruption Ordinance (Cap. 204). (Amended 71 of 1991 s. 7)

td.p: Fee payable for the designation, or the renewal of the designation, of a place as a car testing centre. (Amended L.N. 529 of 1996; L.N. 35 of 1998; L.N. 146 of 1998; 13 of 2024 s. 62)
Fees to be charged in respect of an examination—
Re-examination where made within 14 days of initial examination—
Issue of a duplicate copy of a certificate of roadworthiness—
Light goods vehicle (Replaced L.N. 453 of 1995. Amended L.N. 513 of 1995)
Fee payable for supply of each form of a certificate of roadworthiness—
Light goods vehicle (Added L.N. 50 of 1998. Amended L.N. 196 of 2015)

tr.td: Please see the Road Traffic (Validation of Collection of Fees) Ordinance (Cap. 543) in relation to the fees paid by any proprietor of a car testing centre for the supply of a form of a certificate of roadworthiness in respect of a private car or light goods vehicle during the period from 9.11.1995 to 22.1.1998 (the date immediately before the commencement of L.N. 50 of 1998).

schedule.name: sch9
schedule.heading: Requirements Applicable to Designated Driving Schools

section.name: s1
section.content: Driving instructors giving driving instruction courses shall be holders of valid driving instructors’ licences issued under regulation 22 of the Road Traffic (Driving Licences) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. B) and a person who is not the holder of such a licence shall not give such a course.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: Notice shall be given by the proprietor of a driving school to the Commissioner forthwith— (Amended L.N. 159 of 2017)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of any change of persons employed at the driving school who are authorized to sign course certificates under section 88N(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of any change in the proprietorship of the driving school, or any other matter specified by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if grounds exist for a creditor to present a bankruptcy petition against the proprietor or he has entered into liquidation or has entered into any voluntary arrangement with his creditors or has suffered any distress or execution to be levied upon his goods. (Amended 37 of 1998 s. 6)

section.name: s3
section.content: The fee payable for the designation, or the renewal of the designation, of a driving school is $19,950. (Amended L.N. 174 of 2005; L.N. 50 of 2014; L.N. 159 of 2017)

schedule.name: sch10
schedule.heading: Requirements Applicable to Vehicle Emission Testing Centres

section.name: s1
section.content: A vehicle emission testing centre shall be equipped, staffed, operated and maintained, and the testing of motor vehicles shall be conducted, in accordance with any code of practice issued and from time to time revised by the Commissioner under section 77F(1)(a).

section.name: s2
section.content: Testing of motor vehicles at the vehicle emission testing centre shall be carried out only by an approved vehicle emission tester, and under the general supervision of a responsible person.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: Notice shall be given by the proprietor to the Commissioner forthwith of any change—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of an approved vehicle emission tester employed at the vehicle emission testing centre;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of a responsible person employed at the vehicle emission testing centre; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the ownership of the vehicle emission testing centre, or the financial status of the proprietor, or any other matter specified by the Commissioner.

section.name: s4
section.content: Subject to any practice laid down in the code of practice, the vehicle emission testing centre shall test any motor vehicle produced to it for testing for the purposes of Part 8A of the Ordinance.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: Notices in a form approved by the Commissioner shall be prominently displayed at the vehicle emission testing centre indicating and stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the place is a vehicle emission testing centre;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the hours that the vehicle emission testing centre is open for business;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the names of the approved vehicle emission testers, and of the responsible person at the vehicle emission testing centre;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the fees that are charged at the vehicle emission testing centre;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the addresses of other vehicle emission testing centres within Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the circumstances under which the issue of a certificate of compliance may be refused;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the procedure that may be followed upon a refusal to issue a certificate of compliance; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a warning against the commission of offences under the Prevention of Bribery Ordinance (Cap. 201) and the Independent Commission Against Corruption Ordinance (Cap. 204).

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Fee payable for the designation, or the renewal of the designation, of a place as a vehicle emission testing centre. (Amended 13 of 2024 s. 63)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Fee payable in respect of a test of a motor vehicle—
for a motor vehicle with a positive-ignition engine;
for a motor vehicle with a compression-ignition engine and having a permitted gross vehicle weight exceeding 5.5 tonnes. (Replaced L.N. 90 of 2015 and L.N. 171 of 2015)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Fee payable for supply of form of certificate of compliance.

schedule.name: sch11
schedule.heading: Offences Specified for the Purposes of Section 72A
schedule.text: Any offence mentioned in the Schedule to the Road Traffic (Driving-offence Points) Ordinance (Cap. 375) other than an offence mentioned in item 1, 1A, 2, 4, 4A, 4B, 4C, 5, 5B, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13, 14, 15, 18, 19, 20, 43, 46, 47, 55, 58 or 59 of that Schedule.

schedule.name: sch12
schedule.heading: Requirements Applicable to Driving Improvement Schools and Taxi Service Improvement Schools

section.name: s1
section.content: Only driving improvement course instructors who have been authorized by the Commissioner and who meet such conditions as may be specified by the Commissioner in the designation concerned may give driving improvement courses.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: Notice shall be given by the proprietor of a driving improvement school to the Commissioner immediately if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: there is any change in the particulars of the proprietor of the school, or any other matter specified by the Commissioner by notice in writing to the proprietor which relates to the school; or (Amended 6 of 2012 s. 9)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: grounds exist for a creditor to present a bankruptcy petition against the proprietor or the proprietor has entered into liquidation or has entered into any composition with his creditors or has suffered any distress or execution to be levied upon his goods.

section.name: s3
section.content: The Commissioner may from time to time determine the fees payable for the designation, or the renewal of the designation, of a driving improvement school. (Amended 13 of 2024 s. 64)

section.name: s4
section.content: The Commissioner shall cause notice of the fees he has determined under section 3 of this Schedule to be published in the Gazette. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 58)

section.name: s5
section.content: A notice under section 4 of this Schedule is not subsidiary legislation. (Amended 35 of 2023 s. 58)

section.name: s6
section.content: Only taxi service improvement course instructors who have been authorized by the Commissioner and who meet the conditions specified by the Commissioner in the designation concerned may give taxi service improvement courses.

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: Notice must be given by the proprietor of a taxi service improvement school to the Commissioner immediately if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is any change in the persons employed at the school who are authorized to sign taxi course attendance certificates or taxi course completion certificates under section 102E of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is any change in the particulars of the proprietor of the school, or any other matter specified by the Commissioner by written notice to the proprietor which relates to the school; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: grounds exist for a creditor to present a bankruptcy petition against the proprietor or the proprietor has entered into liquidation or has entered into any composition with the proprietor’s creditors or has suffered any distress or execution to be levied on the proprietor’s goods.

section.name: s8
section.content: The Commissioner may from time to time determine the fees payable for designation, or renewal of designation, of a taxi service improvement school.

section.name: s9
section.content: The Commissioner must cause notice of the fees the Commissioner has determined under section 8 of this Schedule to be published in the Gazette.

section.name: s10
section.content: A notice under section 9 of this Schedule is not subsidiary legislation.

schedule.name: sch13
schedule.heading: Requirements Applicable to Pre-service Training Schools

section.name: s1
section.content: Only pre-service course instructors who have been authorized by the Commissioner and who meet all conditions that may be specified by the Commissioner in the designation concerned may give pre-service courses.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: Notice must be given by the proprietor of a pre-service training school to the Commissioner immediately if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: there is any change in the particulars of the proprietor of the school, or any other matter specified by the Commissioner by notice in writing to the proprietor which relates to the school; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: grounds exist for a creditor to present a bankruptcy petition against the proprietor or the proprietor has entered into liquidation or has entered into any composition with the proprietor’s creditors or has suffered any distress or execution to be levied upon the proprietor’s goods.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: attendance certificate (修習證書), course certificate (課程證書), designation (指定) and proprietor (東主) have the meaning given by section 102H.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: GB Taxonomy (《國標分級》) means China National Standards GB/T 40429-2021: Taxonomy of driving automation for vehicles, issued on 20 August 2021;

SAE Standard J3016 (《SAE J3016標準》) means SAE International Standard J3016: Taxonomy and Definitions for Terms Related to On-Road Motor Vehicle Automated Driving Systems, issued on 16 January 2014 (as amended as at 30 April 2021).

section.name: s2
section.heading: Meaning of autonomous
section.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of autonomous vehicle in section 2, a motor vehicle is autonomous if the motor vehicle is equipped with an AV system that is capable of being operated at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: GB Level 3, 4 or 5; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: SAE Level 3, 4 or 5,

section.continued: irrespective of whether any operation of the vehicle is being performed by the AV system.
